title: Haiti - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 5 February 2021, in Leogane, Ouest, residents erected barricades of flaming tires in demonstration against kidnapping after two people were kidnapped from their community hours earlier. Violent clashes between police and demonstrators were reported, including exchange of gunfire. [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, employees of the ONA insurance agency protested after a colleague of theirs was kidnapped. [size=no report]

Around 5 February 2021 (as reported), in Les Cayes, Sud, anti-government demonstrators erected flaming barricades and threw stones at police officers. The police responded by dispersing the crowd with tear gas. [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, in Leogane, Ouest, kidnappers in three cars abducted a woman.

On 4 February 2021, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, employees of the ONA insurance agency demonstrated in front of the office for the second day in a row after a colleague of theirs was kidnapped by unknown individuals. The demonstrators erected a barricade with benches and burning tires. [size=no report]

On 4 February 2021, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, employees of the ONA insurance agency demonstrated for the second day in a row after a colleague of theirs was kidnapped by unknown individuals. The demonstrators erected barricades with benches and burning tires. [size=no report]
On 4 February 2021, in Mirebalais, Centre, people protested to demand that the President respects the constitutional end of his mandate on 7 February. [size=no report]
On 3 February 2021, in Miragoane, Nippes, dozens of people protested in the street in order to demand that President Moise respects the constitutional end of his mandate on 7 February. [size=dozens]

On 3 February 2021, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, four heavily armed individuals attempted to abduct a diplomat at the consulate of Haiti to the Dominican Republic. The man resisted and was killed by his attackers. 1 fatality.

On 3 February 2021, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, employees of the ONA insurance agency demonstrated after a colleague of theirs was kidnapped by unknown individuals. Demonstrators blocked traffic with their cars and erected barricades of burning tires. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, in Gonaives, Artibonite, police forces launched an operation into the Jubile neighborhood, a stronghold of anti-government opposition members. In the days leading up to the operation, sporadic gunfire could be heard and barricades were erected in strategic locations. During a clash between police and armed men, two bystanders were shot and injured. Eye witnesses say that another person was killed and that the police took his body away. These reports were unverified. At least 1 fatality.

On 3 February 2021, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, several dozens of demonstrators who gathered against the president and asked for his resignation were attacked by residents who claimed having close ties with the government. The residents threw stones. Two people were injured. One of the injured was a journalist. [size=dozens]

On 3 February 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a dozen individuals verbally assaulted former President Privert in front of a radio station where he had just spoken, and attacked his car, puncturing a tire. Opposition groups criticized former President Privert for having been the reason President Moise came to power. Police officers had to use tear as in order to disperse the attackers. No fatalities. [size=a dozen]

On 3 February 2021, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, dozens of employees of the ONA insurance agency protested in front of the office after a colleague of theirs was kidnapped by unknown individuals. [size=dozens]

On 2 February 2021, in Gonaives, Artibonite, unknown individuals attempted to set fire to a hotel owned by the Departmental Director of Public Works. Two vehicles belonging to the state were also set on fire.
On 1 February 2021, in Thomonde, Centre, hundreds of people protested to demand that the President respects the constitutional end of his mandate on 7 February. [size=hundreds]

On 1 February 2021, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, a demonstration was held against President Moise. Demonstrators blocked the roads with flaming tires and threw stones and broken bottles on the road to call on the President to respect the end of his constitutional mandate on 7 February. [size=no report]
On 1 February 2021, in Belladere, Centre, hundreds of people protested to demand that the President respects the constitutional end of his mandate on 7 February. [size=hundreds]
On 1 February 2021, in Hinche, Centre, hundreds of people protested to demand that the President respects the constitutional end of his mandate on 7 February. [size=hundreds]
On 1 February 2021, in Mirebalais, Centre, hundreds of people protested to demand that the President respects the constitutional end of his mandate on 7 February. [size=hundreds]

On 1 February 2021, in Les Cayes, Sud, several hundred members of the Platform Pitit Desalin political party and other opposition groups marched peacefully to call the President to respect the constitutional end to his mandate, which according to opposition groups is on 7 February. Police forces fired in the air and used tear gas to disperse the protest. On this same day a general strike took place in Les Cayes. [size=several hundred]
On 31 January 2021, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, several hundred people protested to call on the President to respect the end of his constitutional mandate on 7 February. [size=several hundred]

On 29 January 2021, in Les Cayes, Sud, hundreds of people demonstrated in the streets to demand that President Moise steps down on 7 February, which is the end of the President's mandate according to the opposition. Demonstrators attempted to set fire to tires but were dispersed by the police. [size=hundreds]

On 29 January 2021, in Leogane, Ouest, several dozen residents demonstrated against President Moise, demanding that he steps down on 7 February which is the end of the President's mandate according to the opposition. The demonstration started peacefully but some fires were reported and demonstrators stole cars which they used to block traffic. [size=several dozen]
On 28 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, more than 200 journalists and people protested against police brutality targeting journalists. [size=more than 200]

On 28 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, police launched an operation against the G-9 Gang. Sporadic gunfire was reported through the day, armoured vehicles were patrolling through the town and barricades of burning tires were erected. Residents complained about heavy tear gas use. Members of the G-9 Gang blocked entrance points with trucks to prevent police from attacking. No fatalities reported.

On 28 January 2021, in Jacmel, Sud-Est, a restaurant belonging to the general secretary of the South East region was set on fire. The fire spread to five houses. The owner accuses the political opposition of having orchestrated this act.

On 27 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, demonstrators erected burning barricades demanding that President Moise steps down. Police intervened with tear gas and live ammunition and one student was shot and wounded. No fatalities. [size=no report]

On 26 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, residents erected burning barricades for the second day in a row to demonstrate against the kidnapping of an entrepreneur from their city and demand that he would be released. [size=no report]
On 26 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, residents protested against kidnappings and insecurity in the city. [size=no report]
On 25 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunmen shot and killed the driver of the Minister of Justice and a woman who was with him. 2 fatalities.
On 25 January 2021, in Montrouis, Artibonite, a police woman involved in the killing of a female students was nearly lynched by residents. The police woman was saved by police. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, in Montrouis, Artibonite, a female students was shot and killed on her way back from school by gunmen who shot at a van from a moving car (drive-by). Three people were arrested as suspects in this killing: a police woman and two men. The police woman was saved by police after residents attempted to lynch her. 1 fatality.

On 25 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, residents in the Bizoton neighbourhood in the south erected barricades in demonstration against the kidnapping of a preacher and a schoolboy. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, students and residents protested in front of the US embassy against kidnapping and insecurity in the country after an employee of a school got kidnapped days earlier. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, residents erected burning barricades and threw stones. The demonstrators demanded that President Moise steps down on February 7 which they say is the end of the President's mandate. [size=no report]
On 25 January 2021, in Montrouis, Artibonite, locals blocked the road in demonstration over the killing of a schoolgirl from the area. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, residents erected burning barricades to demonstrate against the kidnapping of an entrepreneur from their city and demand that he would be released. [size=no report]
On 25 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, students protested against kidnapping and insecurity in the country. [size=no report]
Around 22 January 2021 (as reported), in Dame-Marie, Grand'Anse, heavily armed gang members active in Desormeaux attacked a taxi driver. No fatalities.
On 22 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, hundreds of people including members of the G-9 Gang alliance protested against kidnapping. [size=hundreds]
On 22 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, hundreds of people including members of the G-9 Gang alliance protested against kidnapping. [size=hundreds]

On 21 January 2021, in Miragoane, Nippes, several thousand people took part in an anti-government protest which was dispersed by police using tear gas. During the protest, former Senator of the Fanmi Lavalas political party was arrested alongside twelve allies of his. He was then taken to a police station, where he gave a statement to a radio station, saying that he was arrested on order of the President. Activists gathered in front of the police station where he was held to demand his release. The Senator was released later. [size=several thousand]

On 21 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, hundreds of students demonstrated for the second day in a row. The students were demonstrating against kidnapping and insecurity in the country. Demonstrators erected barricades of burning tires in the streets. They were trying to march into Port-au-Prince but were dispersed by police with tear gas. At least two students were detained and beaten by police. [size=hundreds]

On 21 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, people took to the streets in Portail Leogane in the south of the city to demonstrate against kidnappings and demand the release of a bus driver who was kidnapped the day before. Demonstrators burned tires in the streets and blocked traffic by parking cars in the street. The bus driver was released that same day. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, demonstrators erected flaming barricades on the street and gunshots were heard through the day. Demonstrators demanded that President Moise steps down on 7 February 2021. Police forces dispersed the demonstration with tear gas and a woman was shot in the arm with live ammunition. Several journalists were injured with rubber bullets. [size=no repot]

On 20 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, students of the United Heart College and other schools protested for the third day in a row to demand the release of a kidnapped teacher. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, schoolchildren protested to demand the release of a fellow student who was kidnapped days before. A ransom of 250.000 gourdes was already paid but the victim remained captive. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, demonstrators erected flaming barricades on the street and threw rocks at passing cars. Demonstrators demanded that President Moise steps down on 7 February 2021. Police forces dispersed the demonstration with tear gas. Several journalists were injured with rubber bullets. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, protesters attempted to gather in front of the US embassy to demand that the Haitian President steps down. The protesters were appealing to US President Biden to break with outgoing US President Trump's support for the Moise administration. Only a small group of protesters managed to actually get to the embassy as police officers dispersed the protest with tear gas. [size=no report]
On 19 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, students and teachers of the United Heart College protested for the second day in a row to demand the release of a kidnapped teacher. [size=no report]

On 19 January 2021, outside Mirebalais, Centre, demonstrators blocked the street connecting Hinche to Port-au-Prince over the week on end. Demonstrators placed vehicles on the street and erected flaming barricades. Clashes between demonstrators and law enforcement were reported. The demonstrators demand the resignation of President Moise. In Mirebalais, people attempted to set buildings of several public institutions on fire. [size=no report]

On 19 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, a man wanted for the killing of a well-known constitutional lawyer in 2020 was encountered by police. A gunfight broke out during which the man was hit. He was arrested and taken to the hospital. No fatalities.

On 19 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, protesters held a sit-in protest against kidnappings outside the residence of the Prime-Minister in Musseau. When the protest grew in size, police used tear gas to disperse the protesters. [size=no report]

On 18 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, students and teachers of the United Heart College protested to demand the release of a kidnapped teacher. According to some reports, some students attempted to pressure other students into joining the protest and forcibly shutting down other schools. No violence was reported. [size=no report]

On 18 January 2021, outside Mirebalais, Centre, demonstrators blocked the street connecting Hinche to Port-au-Prince for a week on end. Demonstrators placed vehicles on the street and erected flaming barricades, demanding that the President resigns. [size=no report]

On 18 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, residents demonstrated against kidnappings and impunity that have been taking place in the Port-au-Prince metropolitan area. Demonstrators erected barricades of burning tires and rocks in the Portal Leogane area in the south of the city. Demonstrators demanded the resignation of the President and the release of the owner of a transport company who was kidnapped. [size=no report]
On 17 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, around 30 police officers protested to demand better working conditions and a better salary. [size=around 30]

On 17 January 2021, outside Mirebalais, Centre, demonstrators blocked the street connecting Hinche to Port-au-Prince for a week on end. Demonstrators placed vehicles on the street and erected flaming barricades, demanding that the President resigns. [size=no report]

On 16 January 2021, outside Mirebalais, Centre, demonstrators blocked the street connecting Hinche to Port-au-Prince for a week on end. Demonstrators placed vehicles on the street and erected flaming barricades, demanding that the President resigns. [size=no report]

On 15 January 2021, in Jacmel, Sud-Est, several hundred protesters took to the street to demand that President Moise steps down on 7 February 2021, which according to opposition groups is the end of his mandate. [size=several hundred]

On 15 January 2021, in Les Cayes, Sud, dozens of protesters took to the street to demand that President Moise steps down on 7 February 2021, which according to opposition groups is the end of his mandate. [size=dozens]

On 15 January 2021, in Miragoane, Nippes, protesters took to the street to demand that President Moise steps down on 7 February 2021, which according to opposition groups is the end of his mandate. [size=no report]

On 15 January 2021, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, protesters took to the street to demand that President Moise steps down on 7 February 2021, which according to opposition groups is the end of his mandate. [size=no report]

On 15 January 2021, in Petit-Goave, Ouest, protesters took to the street to demand that President Moise steps down on 7 February 2021, which according to opposition groups is the end of his mandate. [size=no report]

On 15 January 2021, in Saint-Marc, Artibonite, demonstrators took to the street to demand that President Moise steps down on 7 February 2021, which opposition groups see as the end of his mandate. Barricades of burning tires were erected and some unidentified individuals threw bottles at the demonstrators. [size=no report]

On 15 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a few hundred demonstrators took to the streets to demand that President Moise resigns on 7 February of this year, which opposition groups see as the end of his mandate. The demonstrators marched to Delmas and along the route threw stones at businesses, barricades streets and attempted to set a police car on fire. Clashes between police and demonstrators were also recorded. [size=a few hundred]

On 15 January 2021, in Gonaives, Artibonite, residents of the city took to the streets for a protest to demand that President Moise steps down on the 7th of February of this year, which according to opposition groups is the end of the President's mandate. [size=no report]

On 15 January 2021, in Delmas, Ouest, a few hundred demonstrators took to the streets to demand that President Moise resigns on 7 February of this year, which opposition groups see as the end of his mandate. The demonstrators marched from Port-au-Prince, and along the route threw stones at businesses, barricades streets and attempted to set a police car on fire. Clashes between police and demonstrators were also recorded. [size=a few hundred]

On 15 January 2021, outside Mirebalais, Centre, demonstrators blocked the street connecting Hinche to Port-au-Prince for a week on end. Demonstrators placed vehicles on the street and erected flaming barricades, demanding that the President resigns. [size=no report]

On 14 January 2021, outside Mirebalais, Centre, demonstrators blocked the street connecting Hinche to Port-au-Prince. Demonstrators placed vehicles on the street and erected flaming barricades, demanding that the President resigns. [size=no report]
Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang

On 14 January 2021, in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, police clashed with members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang, killing at least three gang members including the leader of the gang. Two police officers were wounded. A number of houses were set on fire by the police, and 12 people including a high ranking member of the gang was arrested. At least 3 fatalities.

On 13 January 2021, in Hinche, Centre, employees of a hospital in Marmont went out to the street in demonstration against insecurity after a colleague of theirs was kidnapped. Demonstrators clashed with police who attempted to disperse the crowd with tear gas. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2021, near Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the Evil Dogs gang was demonstrating by stopping drivers on the highway and preventing traffic near the Croix-des-Missions area. Gunfire could be heard throughout the day. According to reports the police issued a wanted notice for a number of gang leaders, including the leader of the gang in question, causing the gang members to demonstrate. No fatalities. [size=no report]
Around 13 January 2021 (week of), in Dame-Marie, Grand'Anse, members of a gang active in Desormeaux attacked a truck driver, shooting at his truck and riddling it with bullets. No fatalities.

On 13 January 2021, outside Mirebalais, Centre, demonstrators blocked the street connecting Hinche to Port-au-Prince. Demonstrators placed vehicles on the street and erected flaming barricades, demanding that the President resigns. [size=no report]

Around 13 January 2021 (week of), in Anse-d'Hainault, Grand'Anse, a group of rioters set the house of a man on fire. The owner of the house has previously killed a person and fled. No fatalities. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, in Hinche, Centre, armed men opened fire on a taxi driver near Ti Bwadom. According to reports, a network of armed gangs is responsible for a surge in violence in this area. No fatalities.
On 11 January 2021, in Saint-Raphael, Nord, a gang killed six people including a Voodoo priest. The gang had been active in this area for a while, stealing cattle. 6 fatalities.

On 9 January 2021, in Lascahobas, Centre, unknown men set fire to the local church. Gunfire was heard throughout the city and barricades of flaming tires were erected. According to reports, a network of armed gangs caused this violence. No fatalities.
Around 8 January 2021 (as reported), in Jeremie, Grand'Anse, a police officer allegedly raped a minor girl.
On 8 January 2021, in Carrefour, Ouest, heavily armed men made their way into the Little Sisters of Sainte-Therese religious community and kidnapped a nun. She was released 48 hours later.

Around 7 January 2021 (week of), in Lascahobas, Centre, bandits raped five women in the span of a week. According to reports, a network of armed gangs is responsible for a surge of violence in this area.
On 7 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed men shot and killed a police officer near the airfield. After killing the officer, the men stole his service weapon. 1 fatality.
On 6 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified armed men kidnapped two police officers.
On 6 January 2021, in Gonaives, Artibonite, unidentified men kidnapped two police officers from the police station. The kidnappers demand a large sum of money for their release.

On 5 January 2021, in Gonaives, Artibonite, police burned down a Voodoo temple and arrested the priest on allegations of having provided help to local gangs. According to police, the temple was used by gangs as a base of operations.

On 4 January 2021, in Liancourt, Artibonite, several dozen residents protested following a string of kidnappings and extortions by a group of criminals. The protesters gathered outside the police station before marching through the town demanding peace. [size=several dozen]

On 3 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed individuals kidnapped a police inspector downtown. A ransom of 1 million USD was demanded. Later that day, armed men in police uniforms kidnapped a woman, two children and another person from a car and demanded 200 thousand USD for their release.
On 3 January 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed men in police uniforms kidnapped a woman, two children and another person from a car and demanded 200 thousand USD for their release.

On 2 January 2021, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, a police operation into the Canaan neighbourhood with the intent to dislodge the gang that controls this area led to the death of three likely gang members in military uniforms. Two others were injured. 3 fatalities.
On 1 January 2021, in Port-de-Paix, Nord-Ouest, three assailants killed a woman and her two children in Dlosale. Two of the attackers were arrested while the third remains on the run. 3 fatalities.

On 30 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, demonstrators erected barricades of burning tires in the Bourdon neighbourhood to demonstrate against the ongoing problem of kidnappings in the country. [size=no report]

On 28 December 2020, in Delmas, Ouest, healthcare professionals protested to demand the release of two people who were kidnapped six days earlier. They say that the families paid the ransom but the kidnappers have not released the victims. The protest of the employees of the National Laboratory led to a pause in coronavirus testing in Haiti. [size=no report]
On 28 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified gunmen attacked a journalist and another person. The journalist was injured while the other person was killed. 1 fatality.

On 27 December 2020, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, police forces launched an operation and clashed with the 400 Mawozo Gang. During the operation, gun battles took place. Police found human remains in one base of the gang, and also seized four vehicles. 15 people were arrested, but the leader of the gang managed to evade capture. No fatalities reported.

On 26 December 2020, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, unknown individuals shot and killed a police inspector while he was sitting in his car in Petit-Anse. It is reported that in recent days, a gang war has been ongoing in this area. 1 fatality.
On 24 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several individuals kidnapped a Christian Pastor and his daughter. They were released four days later.
On 21 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, workers of the National Ambulance Centre, including health workers, protested to demand the payment of 18 months of unpaid salaries. [size=no report]

On 21 December 2020, in Arcahaie, Ouest, protesters from the Gwoup Rezistans demanded the release of political prisoners including the release of a deputy, jailed for allegedly plotting against the government. The protesters blocked the road. [size=no report]
On 20 December 2020, in Jacmel, Sud-Est, kidnappers took a lawyer and a woman hostage and demanded USD1 million in ransom for their release.
On 20 December 2020, in Dame-Marie, Grand'Anse, several heavily armed men on horseback rode into the property of an US man and kidnapped his child at gunpoint. The child was released two days later.
On 19 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a girl was shot and injured by police forces during an operation in the Bel Air neighbourhood. No fatalities.

On 17 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a police operation continued in the Village de Dieu slum to dislodge the gangs that have controlled this area for years. Heavy gunfire was heard throughout the day. Several houses in the slums were bulldozed by state forces. No fatalities reported.

On 16 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a police operation continued in the Village de Dieu slum to dislodge the gangs that have controlled this area for years. Heavy gunfire was heard throughout the day. Several houses in the slums were bulldozed by state forces. According to reports, one officer was shot and wounded. No fatalities reported.

On 15 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a police operation continued in the Village de Dieu slum to dislodge the gangs that have controlled this area for years. Heavy gunfire was heard throughout the day and armed vehicles were seen in the area. Several houses in the slums were bulldozed by state forces. No fatalities reported.

On 14 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a police operation continued in the Village de Dieu slum to dislodge the gangs that have controlled this area for years. Heavy gunfire was heard throughout the day. No fatalities reported.

On 14 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several residents of the Village de Dieu neighbourhood protested to demand reparations from the state after their houses were ransacked by police during an operation targeting gangs. Police intervened with tear gas. [size=several]

On 13 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a police operation continued in the Village de Dieu slum to dislodge the gangs that have controlled this area for years. Heavy gunfire was heard throughout the day. No fatalities reported.

On 12 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a police operation was started in the Village de Dieu slum to dislodge the gangs that have controlled this area for years. Heavy gunfire was heard throughout the day. No fatalities reported.

On 10 December 2020, in Gonaives, Artibonite, thousands of people protested against ongoing violence and insecurity as well as the recent string of kidnappings in the country. Protesters accused President Moise of being the root of the insecurity. [size=thousands]

On 10 December 2020, in Leogane, Ouest, armed men in two vehicles and dressed in police uniforms kidnapped two men and then contacted the families to demand a USD$1 million ransom. During the kidnapping, one of the two men resisted and was badly beaten by the kidnappers.

On 10 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, thousands of people demonstrated against ongoing insecurity against a backdrop of a recent string of kidnappings in the country. Demonstrators accuse President Moise of being the root of the insecurity. Some demonstrators gathered in front of the US embassy after a security guard of the embassy was kidnapped the day before. Demonstrators set tires of fire and clashed with police officers. Police used tear gas to attempt to disperse the crowd. [size=thousands]

On 8 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a traditional march by thousands of Catholic Christians was held. During the march, participants chanted protest-slogans against kidnapping and insecurity in the country. Protesters also demanded justice for the killing of a Reverend in December 2017. [size=thousands]

On 7 December 2020, in Tabarre, Ouest, protesters gathered in front of the US embassy to protest against insecurity and denounce the alleged collusion between gangs and the authorities in Haiti. [size=no report]
On 7 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, angry residents demonstrated in response to the kidnapping of two people. The demonstrators erected barricades and flaming tires. [size=no report]

On 6 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, at least half a dozen heavily armed men pretending to be police officers kidnapped a man and a woman, who were released again a day later after ransom was paid. While the male victim said that the kidnappers had not been violent with him, the woman said that she was beaten and had her hair and palms of her hands burned.

On 4 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the police of Haiti started an operation in the Village de Dieu neighbourhood to take back control of the neighbourhood controlled by members of the Village de Dieu Gang for the past years. Heavy gun fires were heard throughout the day. The leader of the Village de Dieu Gang went on the television to taunt the police and to say that none of his gang members died in the operation. No fatalities.
On 3 December 2020, in Delmas, Ouest, members of the G-9 Gang attacked a police patrol. No fatalities reported.
On 3 December 2020, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, members of the 400 Mawozo Gang kidnapped 12 schoolchildren in La Temblay. They were later released by the police.

On 3 December 2020, in Jeremie, Grand'Anse, thousands of people marched in protest against insecurity in the country. The protesters say that crime such as kidnapping, armed robberies and attacks are out of control and demanded concrete action from the state. [size=thousands]

On 3 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the G-9 Gang attacked a police patrol in the Village de Dieu neighbourhood. That day, members of the G-9 Gang attacked a police station in Grand Ravine. No fatalities reported.
Around 3 December 2020 (as reported), in Gonaives, Artibonite, police officers killed four alleged gang members in operations to combat kidnapping. 4 fatalities.

On 3 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed men (two of whom were wearing police uniforms) opened fire on an armoured vehicle. It is reported that this incident was a failed kidnapping. No fatalities.

On 2 December 2020, in Leogane, Ouest, hundreds of people protested to demand the release of a local man who was arrested three weeks prior. The protesters say that the man is innocent of the crime he is accused of. [size=hundreds]
On 2 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, employees of the town hall of the capital protested to demand the payments of salaries in arrears. [size=no report]
On 2 December 2020, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, members of the 400 Mawozo Gang have been firing at cars on the road to Ganthier. No fatalities.

On 2 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several doctors and nurses demonstrated downtown against kidnappings and insecurity in the city. Barricades of flaming tires were erected. [size=no report]
On 1 December 2020, in Grand'Anse department, thousands of people marched in the streets to protest against insecurity in the department. Coded at the capital Jeremie. [size=thousands]

On 30 November 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, doctors, nurses and medicine students took to the streets to demonstrate against insecurity after a doctor was kidnapped. Police cracked down on the demonstration with tear gas and rubber bullets, injuring one student. Demonstrators threw stones at police in response. [size=no report]
On 30 November 2020, in Mirebalais, Centre, doctors, nurses and medicine students took to the streets to protest against insecurity after a doctor was kidnapped. [size=no report]
Around 30 November 2020 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several armed men kidnapped a taptap driver who is also a pastor and two of his children in Canape-Vert.

Around 30 November 2020 (week of), in Gonaives, Artibonite, armed individuals kidnapped two women and demanded a ransom. A video of one woman with a bag over her head and her hands tied was published by the kidnappers. Police later arrested 11 people related to the kidnapping.

On 30 November 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, taptap drivers erected flaming barricades in Canape-Vert, blocking the road to demonstrate after a colleague of theirs and his two daughters were kidnapped. [size=no report]

On 29 November 2020, in Leogane, Ouest, police officers asked a man to identify himself. When the man refused, the police officers beat him, took his ID and walked away. The man then threw a bottle at the police, upon which one officer returned and shot the man, killing him. 1 fatality.

On 29 November 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, doctors and medical students of the hospital of the State University of Haiti demonstrated by setting up flaming barricades for the second day in a row after a colleague of theirs was kidnapped for ransom by armed men. The man was released that same day after the ransom was paid. [size=no report]
On 29 November 2020, in Delmas, Ouest, armed men abducted the wife of the head of security of the National Palace and daughter of a prominent member of the RDNP party.
On 28 November 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed men kidnapped a doctor of the hospital of the State University of Haiti. The kidnappers demand a ransom of 300.000 USD for his release.

On 27 November 2020, in Carrefour, Ouest, an ongoing armed clash between police and an unidentified gang continued. The police were supposedly attempting to try and dislodge the armed group form the area after they had been trying to establish a foothold here. Several deaths were reported. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

On 27 November 2020, in Carrefour, Ouest, heavy gunfire continued, produced by members of a gang who were demonstrating after four young men who were allegedly members of this gang were killed earlier this month. [size=no report]

On 26 November 2020, in Carrefour, Ouest, members of a gang based in Mahotiere fired their guns into the air in demonstration against the killing of four young men who were allegedly members of this gang earlier this month. [size=no report]

On 26 November 2020, in Carrefour, Ouest, police intervened during an installation ritual for a gang leader which turned into an armed clash during which at least 4 people were killed. At least 4 fatalities.
On 26 November 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed men kidnapped a former director to the electoral commission of Haiti.

On 25 November 2020, in Hinche, Centre, members of the Papaye Peasant Movement and women marched to protest against gender based violence in Haiti on the International Day for the Elimination of Violence Against Women. [size=no report]
On 25 November 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, 30 women marched in protest against violence, kidnapping and insecurity in the country. [size=30]
Around 25 November 2020 (week of), in Grand'Anse department (coded at capital Jeremie), a group of unknown individuals lynched a young man. Motives unclear. 1 fatality. [size=no report]

On 24 November 2020, in Gonaives, Artibonite, police busted a kidnapping gang. During the arrest, one of the alleged kidnappers opened fire on police who shot back, killing the man. Four others were arrested. 1 fatality.

On 22 November 2020, in Delmas, Ouest, two rival gangs clashed with each other, leaving at least one fatality. The gangs are fighting over territory - one gang that was driven out of Delmas is trying to capture its old territory back. Reports indicate that gang members went house to house accompanied by two police officers looking for people who could be linked to the leader of the rival gang. At least one fatality.
On 22 November 2020, in Jacmel, Sud-Est, a group of armed men including one police officer kidnapped two teenagers and forced them into a car. Police shortly after managed to free the two.

On 21 November 2020, in the Grand'Anse department (coded to Jeremie), police officers got into a firefight with gang members in Ravine-Blanche after intervening in an attack by the gang members against vehicles, killing one and arresting three. 1 fatality.
On 21 November 2020, in the Grand'Anse department (coded to Jeremie), gang members attacked a number of vehicles in Ravine-Blanche. The police intervened in the attack. No fatalities.
Around 20 November 2020 (as reported), in Tabarre, Ouest, several dozen people marched to demand justice for the killing of a woman on 11 November at her place of work. [size=several dozen]

On 20 November 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the dissident police group Fantom 509 demonstrated in the streets against the new Director General of the national police. The rioters set numerous police vehicles on fire. [size=no report]

On 20 November 2020, in Petionville, Ouest, members of the group of dissident police officers Fantom 509 clashed with police. The Prime minister later said that a ''bloodbath'' was averted but it is not clear if anyone was wounded. No fatalities.
On 19 November 2020, in Gonaives, Artibonite, a gang kidnapped a young woman who was released two days later after a ransom was paid.
Around 19 November 2020 (as reported), in Savanette municipality, Centre, four people were killed and their decapitated bodies were later found. 4 fatalities.

On 18 November 2020, in Delmas, Ouest, a group of hundreds of protesters led by the PDD leader marched to the American embassy where a speech was held to demand that the Americans stop intervening in Haitian politics. They gave an ultimatum and asked the President to step down within a week, or a 'revolution' would come. Police attempted to disperse the crowd with tear gas. [size=hundreds]

On 18 November 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police used tear gas and live ammunition to disperse a demonstration of several thousand people who demanded an end to the insecurity and kidnappings in the country. One demonstrator was killed by gunshot and another by police vehicle. At least 8 others were injured. Demonstrators threw stones at the police in response. 1 fatality [size=thousands]
PPD: Platfom Pitit Desalin; AAA: Haiti in Action

On 18 November 2020, in Les Cayes, Sud, protesters including members of the action group AAA and the PPD political party protested against insecurity in the region and demanded the resignation of President Moise and a delegate of the Sud department. According to them, the Sud department delegate is complicit in distributing arms to criminal groups. [size=no report]

On 17 November 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, demonstrators erected flaming barricades in Fontamara, Martissant and Bizoton as part of a demonstration to demand that damaged sections of road would be repaired. [size=no report]

On 17 November 2020, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, thousands of people including many PPD supporters protested against the government of President Moise. The leader of the PDD held a speech where he called for a new revolution. [size=thousands]
On 17 November 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a man in the passenger seat of a car opened fire at another car (drive-by), killing a student. 1 fatality.

On 15 November 2020, in Carrefour, Ouest, dozens of residents demonstrated against insecurity after two young people from the town were killed. They erected flaming barricades during the demonstration. [size=dozens]
On 15 November 2020, in Delmas, Ouest, two armed men on a motorcycle opened fire on the off-duty body guard of a judge in the Croix-des-Bouquets courthouse. No fatalities.
Around 15 November 2020 (month of), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a leading member of the Base 5 Secondes Gang was arrested.

Around 15 November 2020 (month of), in Grand'Anse department (coded at Jeremie), the police got into an armed clash with gang members and killed one. Around the same date, three armed gang members tried to hold up a police vehicle. After a shoot-out the three were arrested. 1 fatality.

Around 15 November 2020 (week of), in Delmas, Ouest, armed men travelling in two cars kidnapped six people and drove them to the Village de Dieu neighbourhood. They were released weeks later. The kidnappers had vehicles with state service license plates.

On 13 November 2020, in Petit-Goave, Leogane, a group of residents went inside the justice palace and demanded the arrest of a former police officer and current the town hall security chief. According to protesters, the former police officer executed two young people in the past. [size=no report]

On 13 November 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a few dozen students of the Ecole Normale Superieure protested following the release of preliminary findings in the investigation of the death of a student during a protest a month earlier. According to the released report, there is no proof that the student was killed by the police, while the students claim otherwise. [size=a few dozen]

Around 12 November 2020 (as reported), in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, a houngan (voodoo priest) was killed and his decapitated body was found in a well. According to reports, a family accused him of having put a spell on a child, which is why he was killed. 1 fatality. [size=no report]
On 12 November 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the car of a judge presiding over the killing of a prominent constitutional lawyer was attacked by individuals throwing stones. No fatalities.

On 11 November 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police officers removed a number of protesting employees from the Ministry of Social Affairs. They have been occupying the premises as part of a protest for the past four weeks. The protesters demanded the payment of 43 months of outstanding salaries. [size=no report]

On 10 November 2020, in Delmas, Ouest, a Christian missionary was kidnapped by armed men who demand a ransom. The church says they can not pay it and asked the public for help. He was released in Port-au-Prince three days later.

On 8 November 2020, in Montrouis, Artibonite, armed men entered the home of a pastor and killed him and his wife. Four men were arrested and two are still wanted. The female victim was seven months pregnant, but doctors managed to save the unborn baby. 2 fatalities.
Around 6 November 2020 (between 1-11 November), near Torbeck, Sud, a girl was killed and beheaded by a gang. She was kidnapped on 1 November and found dead around 11 November in the town of Dantan.

On 6 November 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several dozen people protested in front of the Ministry of Women and Women's Rights and the Ministry of Justice and Public Security to demand justice for the kidnapping, raping and killing of a schoolgirl after her family failed to pay a ransom. [size=several dozens]

On 5 November 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, nearly 2000 people marched against insecurity in the country following the kidnapping, rape and killing of a schoolgirl. Demonstrators erected barricades with flaming tires and smashed windows of state-owned vehicles. Police used tear gas to disperse the demonstrators. [size=nearly 2000]

On 5 November 2020, in Carrefour, Ouest, students protested in the Fontamara area to demand justice for the kidnapping, raping and killing of school girl after her family failed to pay for her ransom. [size=no report]

On 4 November 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, citizens protested against kidnappings and insecurity by blocking the street with cars following the kidnapping, raping and killing of a school girl after her family failed to pay for her ransom. The boyfriend of the girl and alleged gang member is wanted as a suspect in the case. Protesters marched to the Ministry of Justice, where police dispersed the crowd with tear gas. [size=no report]

On 4 November 2020, in Delmas, Ouest, citizens protested against kidnappings and insecurity by blocking the street with cars after a school girl was kidnapped. When her family could not pay the ransom the girl was raped, beaten and killed, and her body subsequently thrown on a trash pile. The boyfriend of the girl and member of a gang is wanted as a suspect in the case. [size=no report]

On 3 November 2020, in Delmas, Ouest, citizens protested against kidnappings and insecurity by blocking the street with cars after a school girl was kidnapped. When her family could not pay the ransom the girl was raped, beaten and killed, and her body subsequently thrown on a trash pile. The boyfriend of the girl and member of a gang is wanted as a suspect in the case. [size=no report]
On 2 November 2020, in Gonaives, Artibonite, a man on a motorcycle shot a university professor outside his home in a drive-by shooting. The victim died in the hospital the following day. 1 fatality.

Around 30 October 2020 (between 29 October - 1 November), in Delmas, Ouest, a school girl was raped and killed, allegedly by bandits who are linked to the Base Krache Dife Gang and the G-9 Gang coalition - including her boyfriend. The bandits kidnapped her on 29 October, demanded a ransom from the victim's family, but the family could not pay. The armed men then indicated where the body of the girl could be found. The girl was found on 1 November. The killing led to days of protests in Port-au-Prince and Delmas. The leader of the G-9 Gang handed over the main suspect of the crime to the police days later. 1 fatality.

On 29 October 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a few dozen protesters gathered in front of the office of the Provisional Electoral Council to protest against a presidential degree on the appointment of electoral advisers. [size=a few dozen]

On 29 October 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, students demonstrated to demand justice for the killing of a student during a student demonstration weeks before. Demonstrators set fire to tires. [size=no report]

On 27 October 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a dozen people organized a sit-in protest in front of the US embassy to denounce American interference in Haiti. The protesters accused the US Ambassador of supporting the G-9 gang. [size=a dozen]
On 23 October 2020, in Carrefour, Ouest, dozens of people protested against the increased number of kidnappings happening in the country. [size=dozens]

On 22 October 2020, in Petit-Goave, Ouest, students protested against the exam texts that they were given for their final exams. They claim that the level of the exam does not match their education level, which has been hampered by the Peyi lock political crisis and the coronavirus health crisis. [size=no report]
Le Nouvelliste; Haiti Press Network; Haiti Standard

On 22 October 2020, in Delmas, Ouest, unidentified individuals in police uniform kidnapped a doctor and a football player who played for the Haitian national team. The kidnappers demanded half a million US dollars ransom.

On 21 October 2020, in Miragoane, Nippes, several dozen students protested against the exams that they have been given, saying that the exams do not match the level of education they received. Education has been hampered by both the 'Peyi lock' political crisis and the coronavirus health crisis. The Nippes departmental director of education went to meet the protesters and said he would consider their complaints. [size=several dozen]

On 17 October 2020, in Delmas, Ouest, hundreds of people joined in an anti-government demonstration on the anniversary date of the killing of Emperor Jean-Jacques Dessalines, the first leader of independent Haiti and considered the founding father of the country. Police tried to disperse the demonstrators with tear gas and at least one demonstrator was injured by bullets. The demonstrators demanded the resigning of President Moise and erected flaming barricades. Demonstrators attempted to burn down a gas station. The demonstration was supposed to reach Port-au-Prince and Petion-Ville but the police prevented it. [size=hundreds]

On 17 October 2020, in Les Cayes, Sud, several dozen members of the Haiti In Action group demonstrated against the government and demanded that President Moise steps down. They also demanded justice for the killing of a student. The demonstrators attempted to erect barricades with burning tires but were stopped by the police. Demonstrators threw stones at police who then attempted to disperse the crowd by opening fire with their weapons in the air. [size=several dozen]
On 17 October 2020, in Les Cayes, Sud, representatives of the Voodoo Kingdom in Haiti marched in the street to commemorate the death of the first Emperor of Haiti. [size=no report]

On 17 October 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several people attacked a car near Canape-Vert. They threw stones and then shot at the car with heavy gunfire. The driver ran away and the car was set on fire. It is unknown why the car was attacked. No fatalities.

Around 16 October 2020 (night of), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, heavy gunfire were heard in the Bel Air neighbourhood. According to reports, at least one G-9 Gang member was killed in the clashes. The leader of the G-9 Gang made threats to opposition activists who said they would hold a massive protest on the 17th of October. 1 fatality.

Around 15 October 2020 (month of), outside Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, gang members destroyed several temporary shelters in a camp for people who were displaced following the earthquake of January 2010. The gang members set the shelters on fire following a dispute with another gang. No fatalities.

Around 14 October 2020 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, two men were killed and their bodies were found. One of the men was a police officer. According to local residents the two men killed each other in a shootout. 2 fatalities.
On 12 October 2020, in Delmas, Ouest, two men on motorcycles shot and killed the bodyguard of an ex-Senator. 1 fatality.
On 10 October 2020, in Petion-Ville, Ouest, armed gang members kidnapped a law student. It was not reported whether or not a ransom was demanded.
On 10 October 2020, in L'Estere, Gonaives, a member of a powerful local gang killed a man by decapitating him. 1 fatality.

On 10 October 2020, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, armed gang members shot and killed a couple who just got back from a trip abroad. The bandits left all the luggage and belongings, discarding the theft hypothesis. 2 fatalities.
On 10 October 2020, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, a group of people lynched a person who allegedly stole a motorcycle. The victim was stoned, dismembered and burned alive. 1 fatality. [size=no report]

On 9 October 2020, in Petionville, Ouest, an armed clash between police officers and unidentified gunmen took place in the Morne-Lazarre neighbourhood. Automatic gunfire was heard throughout the day. No fatalities reported.

On 9 October 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a woman was kidnapped by six men in police uniforms. The victim was then released, unharmed. The attack was connected to a wave of kidnappings perpetrated by gangs.

On 9 October 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, students demonstrated in the streets after a student died at the hands of the police. Police used live bullets and tear gas to disperse the crowd. Two students were injured, one of which received a gunshot wound to the hand. No fatalities. [size=no report]
On 9 October 2020, in Port-de-Paix, Nord-Ouest, dozens of students held a peaceful march to ask for justice for a student who died at the hands of the police. [size=dozens]
On 9 October 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, six armed men in police uniforms abducted two people. They were later released unharmed.

On 8 October 2020, in Carrefour, Ouest, doctors protested against the kidnapping of one of their colleagues days before. The doctors demanded this release. Later that day the victim was released unharmed. [size=no report]

On 8 October 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, students demonstrated for the fourth day in a row after a fellow student of theirs died at the hands of police. They set fire to a number of trailers and broke windshields of cars. No fatalities. [size=no report]

On 8 October 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunfire were heard in the Bel Air neighbourhood throughout the day. Burning barricades were also erected. It is not reported who was shooting or who erected the barricades. No fatalities. [size=no report]

On 7 October 2020, in Saint-Marc, Artibonite, a group of operators in charge of clearing vehicles at the port protested against the raising of tariffs by the customs director of the port. [size=no report]

On 7 October 2020, in Leogane, Ouest, unknown individuals shot at a bank office. The attack is allegedly connected to a new legislation which forces banks to run transactions in the national currency at a benchmark rate. No fatalities.

On 7 October 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, activists organized a sit-in in front of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry to protest and demand that the Minister lower prices of food in the country. [size=no report]

On 7 October 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, students from the university of Haiti demonstrated violently for the third day in a row following the death of one of their fellow students at hands of the police. They set several government vehicles on fire. [size=no report]

On 6 October 2020, in La Fague, Nord-Ouest, armed gang members of the Level Gang attacked and killed an unknown number of people and set fire to numerous houses. The area is described as a war zone. According to local government over 1500 houses have been set on fire in the past two weeks. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

On 6 October 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, students demonstrated for the second day in a row over the death of a student at the hands of the police on the Friday before. A car was set on fire, barricades were erected and several car windows were smashes. Police was present and attempted to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2020, in La Fague, Nord-Ouest, the Level Gang attacked and killed three people and set a number of houses on fire. One of the people who was killed was afterwards decapitated and his head was put on a spike as display.

On 5 October 2020, in Carrefour, Ouest, a doctor was kidnapped by unknown individuals. The men demanded a large ransom. On 7 October, a group of doctors initiated a strike and demanded the release of their colleague. The doctor was released three days later, unharmed.

On 5 October 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, lawyers organized a march and demanded justice for the killing of a renown constitutional lawyers on 28 August. That day, lawyers further protested after being denied entry into the opening ceremony of the 2020-2021 judicial year. [size=no report]
Around 5 October 2020 (as reported), in Jeremie, Grand'Anse, a child was kidnapped from his parents. Days later his dismembered body was found with several organs missing. 1 fatality.

On 5 October 2020, in Leogane, Ouest, unknown individuals attempted to set a bank on fire with motor oil. The attack is allegedly connected to a new legislation which forces banks to run transactions in the national currency at a benchmark rate.

Around 4 October 2020 (weekend of), in Miragoane, Nippes, the bodyguard of a senator shot and killed a man. The victim was trying to calm down the bodyguard who was pointing his gun at a third man, who was complaining about the inefficiency of the senator. 1 fatality.
On 1 October 2020, in Jacmel, Sud-Est, unknown individuals set fire to the gate of the city hall of Jacmel.

On 1 October 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, contractors for the Ministry of Social Affairs and Travel demonstrated outside of the ministry building by erecting burning tires against several months of payment in arrears. In addition to the burning barricades the demonstrators smeared faeces on the facade of the building. [size=no report]
On 1 October 2020, in Carrefour, Ouest, armed men on motorcycles ordered a truck driver to get out of his vehicle before executing him in the street. 1 fatality.
On 1 October 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, an off-duty police officer was shot and killed by gang members, allegedly belonging to the Base Krache Dife Gang. 1 fatality.
On 30 September 2020, in Les Cayes, Sud, several dozen opposition activists protested to demand the resignation of President Moise. [size=several dozen]

On 30 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a few dozen protesters held a sit-in in front of a court house in order to show solidarity with members of the Court of Auditors who received death threats. [size=a few dozen]
On 30 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, students of the faculty of law and economics protested to demand justice for the death of a professor who was killed in late August. [size=no report]
On 30 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed men shot at the car of the son of the former President of the Senate. The son escaped unharmed due to the armoured car he was in. No fatalities.

On 30 September 2020, in Carrefour, Ouest, money transfer agents organized a peaceful protest against a new rule that obliges them to pay for transfers in local currency. This means they would have to exchange US dollars into Gourdes, which would put the agents at a disadvantage in light of the current exchange rate. [size=no report]

On 29 September 2020, in Saint-Marc, Artibonite, several people protested in front of the city hall to demand the opening of an office that delivers and receives of identity documents. According to the protesters, the building which was meant to serve this purpose has been ready for three years but never operated. [size=no report]

On 28 September 2020, in Carrefour, Ouest, high school students protested in front of their school against a recent decision of the Minister of Education to organize seminars for high school students in their last year. [size=no report]
On 28 September 2020, in Saint Jean du Sud, Sud, unknown attackers killed and beheaded a couple. 2 fatalities.

Around 24 September 2020 (as reported), in Fort-Jacques, Ouest, the father of the general director of the National Police of Haiti was killed and his body was found in a water tank. The police implied that the death was being treated as a homicide. 1 fatality.

On 19 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the G-9 Gang and the Base Krache Dife Gang entered the Bel Air neighbourhood, setting houses on fire and shooting with heavy calibre rifles. Clashes with another group of armed men were also reported. Several victims were reported. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

On 19 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a well known television host and actress was kidnapped by 8 hooded and armed men. The men demanded a 2 million USD ransom for her release. On 21 September she was released unharmed.

On 18 September 2020, in Carrefour, Ouest, dozens of residents blocked the road with flaming barricades in demonstration to demand renovation work. They also demanded the appointment of the new mayor to be reversed. [size=dozens]

On 18 September 2020, in Delmas, Ouest, members of the G-9 Gang and local residents marched in the streets to demand that a gang leader who was arrested on 2 September would be released. [size=no report]

On 17 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a demonstration by students to demand justice for the death of the President of the Bar Association was quashed by police officers, using tear gas to disperse the rioters. The rioters responded by erecting burning barricades and throwing stones. [size=no report[
Labour Group (Haiti); Police Forces of Haiti (2017-)

On 16 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified armed individuals on a motorbike and in a pick-up truck arrived at a popular restaurant and set fire to the premise before getting away. The owner of the restaurant is a high ranking police officer, who days earlier allegedly told police officers to stop their violent demonstrations. No fatalities.
Police Forces of Haiti (2017-); Students (Haiti); Fantom 509

On 16 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, over a hundred members of the group of police officers affiliated with Fantom 509 demonstrated to demand the release of an officer who has been incarcerated since May 2020. Masked armed demonstrators on motorcycles, including numerous in police uniforms, drove through the streets. The building of the Economic and Social Assistance Fund, the Center for Reception and Delivery of Identity Documents and the Agricultural and Industrial Finance and Development Company were attacked and cars in the parking were set on fire. The police was later joined by students and other activists as the crowd of demonstrators grew. [size=over a hundred]

On 16 September 2020, in Delmas, Ouest, over a hundred members of the group of police officers Fantom 509 demonstrated in the streets to demand the release of an officer who has been incarcerated since May 2020. Masked armed demonstrators on motorcycles, including numerous in police uniforms, drove from Delmas to Petionville and along the way set fire to over ten police vehicles and a vehicle belonging to the municipality of Delmas. Armed men in trucks blocked the roads and shot in the air from time to time. [size=over a hundred]

On 16 September 2020, in Petionville, Ouest, over a hundred members of the group of police officers affiliated to the Fantom 509 group demonstrated to demand the release of an officer who has been incarcerated since May 2020. Masked armed demonstrators on motorcycles, including numerous in police uniforms, drove from Delmas to Petionville and along the way set fire to over 10 police vehicles. [size=over a hundred]
Around 15 September 2020 (as reported), in Mont-organise, Nord-Est, a woman was killed and beheaded with a machete and her body was later found by locals. 1 fatality.

On 15 September 2020, in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, residents erected flaming barricades in order to demand the fixing of roads in the area to connect Petite-Riviere to the Kano locality. At the end of the day the demonstrators removed the roadblocks themselves. [size=no report]

On 15 September 2020, in Jeremie, Grand'Anse, students protested to demand an end to the teacher's strike for the second day in a row. Teachers in Haiti have been striking for five weeks, leaving many students out of school. Many public schools have been forced to close their doors because of the lack of teachers, and students threaten to disrupt private schools until public school teachers and the state reach an agreement. [size=no report]
On 14 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Nan Ti Bwa gang killed a member of the Baz Pilat Gang. The victim was accused of having killed members of the Ti Bwa gang. 1 fatality.

On 14 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the group of police officers Fantom 509 demonstrated in the streets to demand the release of an officer who has been incarcerated since May 2020. Heavy gunfire associated with the demonstration was heard and fires were set to government vehicles. Rioters threw stones at cars and intimidated passers-by. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, in Delmas, Ouest, members of the group of police officers Fantom 509 demonstrated to demand the release of an officer who has been incarcerated since May 2020. Rioters set fire, intimidated passers-by and threw stones at cars. Police officers used tear gas to disperse the rioters. The building of the Center for Reception and Delivery of Identity Documents was also ransacked after rioters broke into it, destroyed equipment and set fires. SWAT officers intervened and a clash between the two took place [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, in Petionville, Ouest, members of the group of police officers Fantom 509 demonstrated in the streets to demand the release of an officer who has been incarcerated since May 2020. Rioters set fire, intimidated passers-by and threw stones at cars. Police officers used tear gas to disperse the rioters. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, in Miragoane, Nippes, teachers protested and held a sit-in to demand better working conditions, payment and to protest against the opening of schools during coronavirus. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, in Jacmel, Sud-Est, hundreds of students protested to demand an end to the teacher's strike. Teachers in Haiti have been striking for five weeks, leaving many students out of school. Many public schools have been forced to close their doors because of the lack of teachers, and students threaten to disrupt private schools until public school teachers and the state reach an agreement. [size=hundreds]

On 14 September 2020, in Marigot, Sud-Est, teachers of public schools protested. Police used tear gas to break up this protest. Teachers throughout Haiti have been striking for five weeks, with intermittent protests against the lack of coronavirus measures as well as poor working conditions and payment issues. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, in Bainet, Sud-Est, teachers of public schools protested. Police used tear gas to break up this protest. Teachers throughout Haiti have been striking for five weeks, with intermittent protests against the lack of coronavirus measures as well as poor working conditions and payment issues. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, in Jeremie, Grand'Anse, hundreds of students protested to demand an end to the teacher's strike. Teachers in Haiti have been striking for five weeks, leaving many students out of school. Many public schools have been forced to close their doors because of the lack of teachers, and students threaten to disrupt private schools until public school teachers and the state reach an agreement. [size=hundreds]

On 14 September 2020, in Jacmel, Sud-Est, teachers of public schools protested. Police used tear gas to break up this protest. Teachers throughout Haiti have been striking for five weeks, with intermittent protests against the lack of coronavirus measures as well as poor working conditions and payment issues. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, in Gonaives, Artibonite, hundreds of students demonstrated to demand the end of the teachers' strike. Teachers in Haiti have been on strike for five weeks, leaving many students out of school. Many public schools have been forced to close down because of the lack of teachers. Students threaten to disrupt private schools until public school teachers and the state reach an agreement. Students from one school attacked another school and the two groups clashed, throwing stones at each other. More than a dozen students were injured. [size=hundreds]

On 14 September 2020, in Saint-Marc, Artibonite, teachers held a protest to demand better working conditions, payment and to protest against the opening of schools during coronavirus. [size=no report]

On 12 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, rioters in Haiti including activists and police officers demonstrated against the arrest of five officers in the investigation of the death of the President of the Bar Association. Rioters set more than 20 cars on fire. Under the pressure, the five arrested officers were released. [size=no report]

On 10 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, students and activists rioted to demand justice over the death of the President of the Bar Association on 28 August. Police forces used tear gas to quell the demonstration, and rioters set a government vehicle on fire. [size=no report]

On 10 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, high school students demonstrated over the lack of teachers in Haitian schools, as teachers have been striking for a month. Police vehicles were burned and the offices of Radio TV Caraibes was stoned. It is unclear whether these were perpetrated by schools students or university students who were demonstrating over the killing of President of the Bar Association that day. [size=no report]
On 10 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, hundreds of people protested to demand the release of a gang leader who was arrested. Police intervened with tear gas. [size=hundreds]

On 9 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, hundreds of students from several high schools demonstrated in the capital. Some students looted their school over the lack of teachers that have been on strike for a month. They vandalized school property and threw bottles and stones. A number of people were injured. [size=hundreds]

On 9 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a police operation was launched into the Delmas neighbourhood. Shootout were heard all day and police vehicles with bullet holes were spotted. According to some reports, the G9 gang coalition was involved in the shootout. A number of houses were set on fire and people were reportedly injured. Police say that the operation was intended to protect residents from rival gangs that have been clashing in this area and to arrest the leader of the G9 gang. No fatalities.

On 8 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, students from several high schools in the capital started looting their school as part of a demonstration over the lack of teachers in schools in Haiti, as teachers have been on strike for a month. They vandalized school property and threw bottles and stones. A number of people were injured. [size=no report]

On 7 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, students of the law faculty demonstrated and demanded justice for the killing of the President of the Bar of Haiti. The police and protesters clashed. Police used tear gas and opened fire, protesters threw stones in response. Two police officers were injured and one protesters was shot dead. A child died of asphyxiation after excessive use of tear gas. 2 fatalities. [size=no report]

On 7 September 2020, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, teachers and students marched in the streets to protest and ask for additional teachers in the classrooms and the payment of outstanding salaries for teachers. Teachers have been on strike for a month. [size=no report]
On 7 September 2020, in Gonaives, Artibonite, at an ambulance center employees put up a barricade and protested to demand the payment of more than a year worth of unpaid salary. [size=no report]

On 7 September 2020, in Leogane, Ouest, residents blocked the road with burning tires and rocks as part of a demonstration over flooding that damaged their town for the second time. Clashes with police were recorded. Storm Laura of August 23 flooded Leogane and two floods have happened since then. [size=no report]

On 7 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, protesters took to the streets and blocked the road with a truck in the Cite Soleil to demand the release of a number of prisoners who they say are in prison for political reasons. [size=no report]

On 7 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a few dozen police officers members of the Haiti National Police Union marched from the airport to the National Palace, demand the reinstating of a spokesperson who was dismissed. They erected flaming barricades. The demonstration was dispersed by police forces. [size=a few dozen]

On 5 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the Evil Dogs Gang clashed with members of the G-9 Gang, leading to the killing of at least four people and several houses being set on fire. At least 4 fatalities.

On 5 September 2020, in Leogane, Ouest, residents blocked the road with burning tires and rocks as part of a demonstration over flooding that damaged their town. Storm Laura of August 23 flooded Leogane and two floods have happened since then. [size=no report]

On 3 September 2020, in Gonaives, Artibonite, lawyers organized a march in the street to express their anger over the death of the President of the Haitian Bar Association days before. [size=no report]

On 3 September 2020, in Jeremie, Grand'Anse, several dozen lawyers organized a march in the street to express their anger over the death of the President of the Haitian Bar Association days before. [size=several dozen]
On 3 September 2020, in Miragoane, Nippes, lawyers organized a march to express their anger over the death of the President of the Haitian Bar Association days before. [size=no report]
On 3 September 2020, in Port-de-Paix, Nord-Ouest, lawyers organized a march to express their anger over the death of the President of the Haitian Bar Association days before. [size=no report]

On 3 September 2020, near Leogane, Ouest, the chief training instructor for the Haitian SWAT-team was killed by unknown gunmen while he was fixing a flat tire. The gunmen came on motorcycles and shot him in the head. Another person in the car was also wounded. 1 fatality.

On 3 September 2020, in Petit-Goave, Ouest, several dozen lawyers organized a march to express their anger over the death of the President of the Haitian Bar Association days before. [size=several dozen]

On 3 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several dozen lawyers organized a march to express their anger over the death of the President of the Haitian Bar Association days before. Protesters marched to the ministry of justice, calling for its closure, but were prevented by the police from reaching it. [size=several dozen]

On 3 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, students of the law faculty rioted to express their anger over the death of the President of the Bar Association and a professor of their university. They threw stones at the police and set barricades of flaming tires. [size=no report]

On 3 September 2020, in Jacmel, Sud-Est, several dozen lawyers organized a march to express their anger over the death of the President of the Haitian Bar Association days before. [size=several dozen]

On 2 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, members of the G-9 Gang, supported by armoured vehicles sent by the national police, attacked people in the Bel-Air neighbourhood. Several people were killed and their bodies were burned. Several houses and cars were burned as well. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

On 1 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several hundred people demonstrated in several areas of the capital to demand justice for the death of the President of the bar of Haiti, a well known and influential lawyer. Rioters set tires and a car on fire, blocked the road with stones and police intervened with tear gas. Among the demonstrators, there were law students. [size=several hundred]

On 1 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed clashes between rival gangs and involving the Delmas 6 Gang were reported. Shot were fired, and cars and houses were set on fire. At least 27 houses burned out and 25 cars. No fatalities.
Le Nouvelliste; Haiti Standard; Haiti Press Network

On 31 August 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gang members of the Base Krache Dife and members of the G-9 alliance attacked members of the Platon Bel Air Gang and the Base Nan Lakwa Gang in the Bel Air district of the capital in retaliation for an attack perpetrated the same day in which six people died. According to eye witnesses at least one resident was injured by bullets. Bursts of gunfire could be heard throughout the day and houses were set on fire. Residents accuse the Delmas 6 Gang of being responsible for the armed clashes. Six fatalities.

On 31 August 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, students of the faculty of law and economics of the State University of Haiti demonstrated following the death of the President of the bar association of Haiti. The students blocked the street with chairs and burning tires. [size=no report]
On 30 August 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, an off duty police officer was shot dead in unclear circumstances by unknown armed men while on his way home. 1 fatality.
On 29 August 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a journalism student was shot dead in the Canape Vert neighbourhood. 1 fatality.
Le Nouvelliste; Haiti Standard; Haiti Press Network

Around 29 August 2020 (overnight), in Petion-Ville, Ouest, a well-known lawyer, professor and head of the Port-au-Prince Bar Association was killed and his body was found with several gunshot wounds at the front door of his own home. The lawyer was killed hours after publicly criticizing the government. Three days of national mourning were declared by President Moise in response to the shooting. 1 fatality.

On 27 August 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, teachers protested to demand better working conditions and the payment of their salaries. The protesters also demanded the resignation of the Minister of Education. [size=no report]

On 27 August 2020, in Port-au-Prince, students of the Faculty of Human Sciences at the State University of Haiti burned tires and prevented the inauguration of a renovated building in support to demonstrations over labour conditions and the non-payment of teachers' salaries. [size=no report]

On 27 August 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, five armed men on three motorcycles chased a car and opened fire on it with heavy weapons, killing a man inside and injuring the driver and a woman. The driver shot back with a revolver. 1 fatality.

Around 19 August 2020 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a peaceful protest was held by parents of students against the transfer of a school's principal. During the protest the chairman of the parents' committee was arrested. [size=no report]
On 15 August 2020, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, several armed men attacked a nightlife center. No fatalities reported.
On 12 August 2020, in La Fague, Nord-Ouest, the Level Gang attacked and killed six people, setting over 60 houses on fire. 6 fatalities.

On 5 August 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, three armed men including a police officer attacked the premises of the university hospital La Paix. They ransacked the building, smashed windows and windshields of cars and opened fire. Staff of the hospital fled the scene in panic. No fatalities reported.
On 3 August 2020, near Ganthier, Ouest, the 400 Mawozo Gang shot and killed a woman and her 4 month old baby in a bus. Six others were injured. 2 fatalities.
