On 30 July 2020, near Gressier, Ouest, residents blocked the streets in protest against the ongoing cattle theft that is occurring in the area. [size=no report]
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 30 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, heavily armed individuals attacked the former government commissioner at the court of first instance of Port-au-Prince. No fatalities.
On 29 July 2020, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, members of the human rights organization SOHDDH were beaten and raped by 400 Mawozo gang-members.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 28 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a woman was shot in the chest and killed by members of the Ti Gabriel Gang. 1 fatality.

On 28 July 2020, in La Vallee, Sud-Est, hundreds of people blocked the highway in protest against insecurity in the community. Gang activity in this area has caused residents to live in fear. After the protest, one of the gang leaders in the area went on the radio and made death threats against journalists and organizers of the march. [size=hundreds]

On 28 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a journalist was attacked by armed men. This attack took place after the leader of one of the main gangs of Haiti has gone on the radio to threaten journalists. The Association of Haitian Journalists raised the alarm over attacks conducted by gangs and targeting the press in Haiti. No fatalities reported.

On 27 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, people who were trained as civil administrators and promised a government job protested in front of the office of management and human resources to demand that they be given a job. They announced a week of mobilization. [size=no report]

On 26 July 2020, in Hinche, Centre, Christians marched in protest against the new penal code of the country, which they believe goes against Christian values. Among other things, the protesters claim that the new penal code would fine pastors who refuse to administer gay marriages. [size=no report]

On 26 July 2020, in Jeremie, Grand'Anse, Christians marched in protest against the new penal code of the country, which they believe goes against Christian values. Among other things, the protesters claim that the new penal code would fine pastors who refuse to administer gay marriages. [size=no report]

On 26 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, thousands of Christians marched in protest against the new penal code of the country, which they believe goes against Christian values. Among other things, the protesters claim that the new penal code would fine pastors who refuse to administer gay marriages. [size=thousands]

On 25 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, a pregnant woman was killed by members of the G-9 gang coalition as part of ongoing gang warfare. According to reports, her attack is connected to her husband's collaboration with Lavalas Family. 1 fatality.

On 23 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a man did not return home after being allegedly kidnapped by members of the Belekou Gang.

On 22 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a van was captured and its occupants taken by the Belekou Gang. The occupants have been missing ever since.

On 22 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a bus was intercepted by the Nan Boston gang. Five women on board were raped throughout the day before being released 9 hours later, while 12 men were killed by gunshot or machete. 12 fatalities.

On 22 July 2020, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, members of the BSAP - police security forces watching natural areas - raided a police station to release a member of their brigade who was arrested the day before. They held the police officers at the station at gunpoint and released their colleague.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 20 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Nan Boston Gang invaded the Soleil 13 area and killed several people. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 20 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a man was taken by armed gang members and his execution was filmed and posted on social media. 1 fatality.
Around 20 July 2020 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, two men on a motorcycle opened fire targeting two cars. The cars had bulletproof plating and therefore nobody was injured. 0 fatalities.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 19 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the Belekou gang launched a retaliatory attack some 10 hours after their base was overtaken by members of the Ti Gabriel gang. Supported by armoured personnel carriers of the National Police of Haiti that were allegedly hijacked, they took back the building and killed six gang members and two other people. The gang members were shot dead and the other two were thrown from the top of the building. 8 fatalities.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 19 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Belekou gang killed two people in the Nan Brooklyn neighbourhood. The attack was coordinated by the G9 gang coalition. 2 fatalities.

On 19 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, men of the gang led by Ti Gabriel attacked the G-9 gang in Belekou in the middle of the night. The Ti Gabriel gang attacked a building used as a base by the men led by the leader of the Belekou gang and killed eight of men who were in the building, as well as seizing a number of large calibre rifles. 8 fatalities.
On 17 July 2020, in Delmas, Ouest, a police officer was shot in the head by unknown perpetrators in the Delmas 32 area. Four men were arrested in relation to this killing. 1 fatality.

On 17 July 2020, in Petionville, Ouest, three people were kidnapped in the Vivy-Mitchell area, including one child. These three were rescued by police the following day from an area between Drouillard and Canaan, north of Port-of-Prince. The kidnappers had demanded one million dollars in ransom.
On 16 July 2020, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, thousands of persons protested against changes in the criminal code which would decriminalize homosexuality. [size=thousands]

Around 15 July 2020 (month of), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a van carrying people was captured and the people taken hostage by the G-9 Gang. People in the van have been missing ever since.

Around 15 July 2020 (month of), in Croix-des-Bouquets, several armed men hijacked and forced their entry into an ambulance and shot the injured man that the ambulance was transporting. They then let the ambulance go again. The attack took place in an area known to be controlled by gangs. 1 fatality.

On 15 July 2020, in Gros-Morne (Artibonite), rioters blocked roads to demonstrate against a presidential decree nominating municipal councils. Rioters set a school bus and a garbage truck on fire. [size=no report]

Around 14 July 2020 (as reported), in Tabarre (Port-au-Prince), community members blocked roads and armed men rioted as part of a wave of demonstrations rejecting a presidential decree nominating municipal councils and mayors. [size=no report]
Around 14 July 2020 (as reported), in Gonaives (Artibonite), community members marched to protest against a presidential decree nominating municipal councils. [size=no report]
On 14 July 2020, overnight, in Gros-Morne (Artibonite), demonstrators set stores and cars on fire rejecting a presidential decree nominating municipal councils and mayors. [size=no report]

Around 14 July 2020 (as reported), in Desdunes (Artibonite), community members set the city hall on fire as part of a wave of demonstrations rejecting a presidential decree nominating municipal councils and mayors. [size=no report]

On 12 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunmen under the leadership of the Belekou leader and the G-9 coalition attacked a slum in the Cite Soleil and killed five people including an 8 month old baby and injured several others. 5 fatalities.
On 11 July 2020, in Gressier (Port-au-Prince), community members blocked a road to protest against a presidential decree nominating municipal councils. [size=no report]

On 10 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a woman was shot in the head at the Nan Brooklyn market by unknown assailants. Her body was burned afterwards. 1 fatality.

On 8 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a bus was captured by members of Nan Boston and Belekou gangs. At least one passenger has been missing ever since.

On 8 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a motorcycle taxi operator went missing. Eye witnesses told the wife of the victim that he was taken by members of the Belekou gang.

On 7 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a van was captured by members of the Belekou Gang and all the passengers taken. On 7 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, three armed gang members raped them two women before releasing them.

On 7 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a number of areas of the capital were blocked off by flaming barricades. Hundreds of people are said to have joined the march and cheered for the alliance of gangs. [size=hundreds]

On 7 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gangsters of the Belekou and Nan Boston Gangs kidnapped a man and took him to Nan Boston neighbourhood. There they gave him a phone so he could call his wife to say goodbye before killing him. The attack was coordinated by the G9 gang coalition. 1 fatality.

On 7 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gangsters of the Belekou gang killed a man and burned his body. The attack was coordinated by the G9 gang coalition. 1 fatality.

On 6 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a peaceful sit-in demonstration against gang violence, impunity and corruption in front of the Ministry of Justice was violently struck down by police forces, who used tear gas and live ammunition to disperse the demonstrators. When police intervened the demonstrators started erecting burning barricades. [size=no report]

On 6 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gangsters of the Belekou and Nan Boston gangs killed a man in the Nan Brooklyn neighbourhood. The attack was coordinated by the G9 gang coalition. 1 fatality.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 5 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, 26 people were attempting to flee gang violence in the Cite Soleil when they were ambushed by gang members of the Nan Boston Gang and Belekou Gang. According to eye witnesses, they were killed and their bodies were burned. None of the people have been seen ever since. 26 fatalities.
Around 5 July 2020 (as reported), in Cotes-de-Fer, Sud-Est, a group of young people held a peaceful protest near the city hall against nepotism. [size=no report]

Around 5 July 2020 (as reported), in Cotes-de-Fer, Sud-Est, unknown individuals attempted to burn down the city-hall of the town during a demonstration, reportedly to discredit the demonstrators. [size=no report]
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 5 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Belekou Gang stopped a car and told the passengers to get out. They beat them and killed them, burning the bodies. One of the victims was allowed to leave but she died from the beating later. The attack was coordinated by the G9 gang coalition. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

Around 5 July 2020 (as reported), in Saint-Marc, Artibonite, an off-duty police officer harassed a woman at a local festival. A man tried to defend the woman, after which the officer fired his gun, injuring the man and two bystanders. When the officer ran out of bullets, a crowd started attacking him with stones and machetes, killing him and burning his body. 1 fatality. [size=no report]

On 5 July 2020, in La Vallee, Sud-Est, a man was killed in an on-going dispute between two regional gangs - Les Bouc 18 and Les Abroite. It is believed that the victim was thought to be an informant for one of the gangs and was killed by the other gang. 1 fatality.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 4 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a woman was killed with a single bullet to the head (execution-style) and her body then burned. 1 fatality.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 4 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the leader of the Belekou Gang and spokesperson for the G-9 Gang executed a man himself with a gunshot in the head (execution-style). 1 fatality.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 4 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the G-9 gang coalition shot and killed a man in front of his house. 1 fatality.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 3 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, two armed gang members raped a woman in the streets.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 3 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, men armed with machetes attacked a man in his own home and beheaded him. Afterwards they set fire to the man's corpse and home. 1 fatality.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 3 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed men attacked the Nan Brooklyn market and killed three people and burned their bodies. It was later stated that the attack was conducted by members of the Belekou gang and coordinated by the G9 gang coalition. That day, in another G9 led attack, armed men of the Belekou Gang killed two men in the Soleil 17 neighbourhood, decapitated them and then burned their bodies. 5 fatalities.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 3 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, members of the Belekou and Nan Boston gangs stopped a bus and held its passengers captive. The passengers were taken to the Nan Boston neighbourhood where all the women were released and all the men killed. The attack was coordinated by the G9 gang coalition. Unknown number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 2 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armoured vehicles allegedly hijacked to the Haitian National Police drove into the Cite Soleil neighbourhood and shot at passers by and at houses in a drive-by shooting. The attack takes place in the context of intense incrusion of gangs in the area. At least 5 people were killed and ten injured. At least 5 fatalities.

On 2 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a man was killed by unknown assailants and his body was burnt. 1 fatality.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 1 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the G-9 Gang climbed on top of a building called Love and Hope in the Cite Soleil neighbourhood and opened fired, killing at least three people. At least 3 fatalities.

On 30 June 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a silent protest march was organized in which a few dozen people participated. The protest was held to ask for justice for the two young people who disappeared last week. Two burnt bodies were later found that are thought to be theirs. [size=a few dozen]

On 29 June 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, 30 minutes after protesters gathered and started a sit in outside the Ministry of Justice to protest against police violence, the police dispersed the protesters with tear gas. [size=no report]
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 26 June 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed men attacked the Nan Brooklyn market and killed several people. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.
On 26 June 2020, in Ganthier, Ouest department, a man shot people randomly, killing six and injuring three. 6 fatalities.
On 26 June 2020, in Ganthier, Ouest department, a man killed five people randomly in the street and was then lynched by a vigilante group in the street. 1 fatality. [size=no report]

On 20 June 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, five armed gang members broke into a house and raped three women.
On 19 June 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the deputy commissioner of the court of first instance of Port-au-Prince was killed by gunshots while in his car. 1 fatality.

On 16 June 2020, in Gonaives, Artibonite, demonstrations after the killing of a well known and influential anti-government activist persisted for a second day, until the authorities intervened and stopped them. Barricades of burning tires were erected. [size=no report]

On 15 June 2020, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, the municipal government in cooperation with the police started demolishing houses in the Shada 2 neighbhourhood in retaliation against the Ajivit Gang. In clashes between this gang and the Nan Bannann' Gang the week before six people were killed, including a police officer.

On 15 June 2020, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, the police arrested 30 people connected to the Ajivit Gang, who the authorities hold responsible for the death of a police officer the week before in clashes between this gang and the Nan Bannann' Gang.

Around 15 June 2020, in Gonaives, Artibonite, a well-known member of the political opposition and influential activist was shot dead. Violent demonstrations were held in the immediate aftermath of the news of his death being made public. 1 fatality.

On 15 June 2020, in Gonaives, Artibonite, the death of a well-known and influential anti-government activist sparked demonstrations. Rioters erected barriers of flaming tires and barricades, blocking access to markets and the commercial center of the city. [size=no report]

On 15 June 2020, in Petion-Ville, Ouest, two people - an engineer, and a teacher, school principal and poet - and their son were shot and killed in their own home in Peguy-Ville by two gunmen. It is unknown what the motive was but it is reported that the wife had been threatened for several weeks. Nothing was stolen from the house. Neighbours heard men on motorcycles near the house around the time that it happened. The intruders also wounded the guard with two gunshots. 3 fatalities.

On 13 June 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a person was taken by members of the Nan Boston Gang and dragged to a secluded place where he was killed. His body was then set on fire. The attack was coordinated by the G9 coalition. 1 fatality.

On 12 June 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, the creation of an alliance of 9 armed gangs, including Delmas 6 Gang, Baz Pilat Gang, Ti Junior Gang, Base Nan Tokyo Gang, was announced under the leadership of Jimmy Cherizier alias Barbecue.

At least three armed men and one police officer were wounded, and one police officer and one armed man were killed. Residents of the neigbhourhood evacuated because of fear for reprisals in the wake of the shootout. 16 gang members were arrested by police. 2 fatalities.
On 9 June 2020, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, two gang members were killed by their own gang for treason in the Barriere Bouteille neighbourhood. 2 fatalities.
On 9 June 2020, in Jacmel, Sud-Est, more than a hundred people gathered for a protest with the Black Lives Matter movement and to honour the memory of George Floyd. [size=more than a hundred]

Around 8 June 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, a medical research and treatment center which had been working on the treatment of coronavirus was destroyed in a fire. The center was located in a part of the city where gang violence has flared in recent weeks, and had been victim to banditry and threats.
Police Forces of Haiti (2017-); Civilians (Haiti); Journalists (Haiti)

On 7 June 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police officers and political activists demonstrated for the release of a police officer who had been arrested, an increase in the salary of police officers and against the way in which the government managed the coronavirus in the country. The demonstrators demanded the departure of President Moise. Demonstrators erected barriers of burning tires. Police forces attempted to disperse the demonstrators with teargas. On 3 June 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Delmas 6 Gang raped a woman. The cousin of the victim who witnessed the rape was abducted by the gang members.

On 3 June 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, men of the Belekou Gang raped at least two women in the Cite Soleil. One of the women was also brutally beaten by the rappers. In Nan Brooklyn, four members of the Belekou Gang raped another woman in Nan Brooklyn.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 3 June 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a van with passengers was intercepted and taken to Nan Brooklyn where three women on board were raped by gang members.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 3 June 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a man was captured and killed by members of the G-9 Gang on the road to the airport. The body of the victim was then set on fire. 1 fatality.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 3 June 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, two men were shot and then burned by gang members of an unknown gang in the Nan Brooklyn market of Cite Soleil. 2 fatalities.

On 2 June 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, several dozens of members of the Corps of civil Engineers and Architects protested outside the office of the Human Resources branch of the government. The government promised that these engineers and architects would be given jobs in the government, a promise which has not been kept according to the protesters. [size=several dozens]

On 1 June 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, an off-duty police officer stationed in the Cite Soleil neighbourhood was killed with two bullets by unknown gunmen nearby the police station. 1 fatality.

Around 31 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, an attack by Grand-Ravine gang members on the Martissant neighbourhood left two dead and several houses on fire. One of the victims is allegedly a voodoo priest who was executed. 2 fatalities.

Around 28 May 2020 (week of), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, in a retaliation attack by gang members from Boston and Belekou parts of town a number of people were killed. Unverified reports talk of at least 6 fatalities.
Delmas 6 Gang; Ti Junior Gang; Unidentified Gang (Haiti)
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 27 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed men from a variety of gangs (Delmas 6, Ti Junior, Base Krache Dife Gang) attacked the territory held by Ti Gabriel, their rival. At least four people were killed and more than 20 people were injured. Numerous houses were set on fire. At least 4 fatalities.

On 26 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a police officer who was on patrol in Cite Soleil was caught in between ongoing clashes between armed groups and was shot in the face. The officer was rused to the hospital. It is not reported whether he survived.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 26 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed vehicles of the national police of Haiti arrived at the area where gang members had been staging attacks for two days (nan Brooklyn in City Soleil) and threw tear gas in all directions. Residents who tried to flee were gunned down, killed with knifes or stoned with bricks. Many bodies were burned or thrown in the sea. Surviving eye witnesses reported seeing people getting beheaded while still alive. At least 5 fatalities.

On 26 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, amed clashes between armed groups broke out in the Cite Soleil neighborhood. During these armed clashed several civilians were wounded and houses were set on fire. No fatalities were reported.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 25 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gang members of a coalition of gangs led by Base Krache Dife Gang and Delmas 6 and their allies attacked civilians in poor neighbourhoods of Port-au-Prince, killing two. One body was burned. 2 fatalities.
Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 24 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a coalition between Delmas-6 Gang and Ti Junior attacked other gangs operating in the La Saline and Cite Soleil parts of the capital. Houses were set on fire and 18 people were killed. 18 fatalities.

On 23 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, five police officers were abducted by armed men in the Pont-Rouge area of La Saline neighbourhood. The officers were released a few hours later unharmed, though without their weapons. Residents of the area are skeptical about the kidnapping, and believe it to be a scheme to transfer weapons to armed groups operating in this part of town.

On 20 May 2020, in Montrouis, Artibonite department, a group of armed men burned down beach properties and vehicles. The armed men threatened to burn down everything and cut the heads of the residents of the area. No motive was mentioned. 0 fatalities.

On 20 May 2020, in Arcahaie municipality, Ouest department, in reprisal to the death of a young man a day prior, inhabitants from Carries set several properties on fire. The conflict is an on-going land disputes between inhabitants from Carries and Fonts Baptiste.
On 20 May 2020, in Delmas, Ouest department, a police inspector was shot dead while driving in his car. The attackers then stole his weapon. 1 fatality.

On 19 May 2020, in Caries, Ouest department, a young man was killed by a group inhabitants from Fonds Baptiste over an on-going land dispute with inhabitants from Carries. 1 fatality. [size=no report]

On 19 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, employees of the Ministry of Culture and Communication demonstrated while erecting burning barricades. The employees demand their pay in arrears, claiming to not have been paid for between 10 to 12 months. [size=no report]
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 18 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a gang leader and two other chief gang officers under his leadership were shot and killed by men in an armed vehicle that was provided to them by the national police. 3 fatalities.

On 18 May 2020, in Delmas, Ouest department, anti-government protests took place in several locations in and around the capital. The protesters demanded the immediate resignation of the President who they blame for the crisis. Police intervened with tear gas and arrested several protesters including members of the MODEP movement. [size=no report]

On 18 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, anti-government protests took place in several locations in and around the capital. The protesters demanded the immediate resignation of the President who they blame for the crisis. Police intervened with tear gas and arrested several protesters including members of the MODEP movement. [size=no report]
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 18 May 2020, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, unknown individuals poured sugar into the generator of the Palace of Justice, destroying it. The electrical wiring connecting to the courthouse were cut.
On 17 May 2020, in Jacmel, Sud-Ouest department, unknown individuals destroyed a quarantine center for coronavirus patients, and then set it on fire.
On 16 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, a political activist was assassinated by armed individuals when returning from a 'political meeting'. 1 fatality.

On 15 May 2020, in Delmas, Ouest department, teachers demonstrated in front of a building of the Education Ministry to demand salary in arrears be paid. They blocked the road with flaming tires. [size=no report]
On 15 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, teachers blocked the roads to demand several months of pay in arrears. [size=no report]
On 15 May 2020, in Fonds-Parisien, Ouest department, residents demonstrated against the arrest of a police officer. The road was blocked with burning tires. [size=no report]

On 15 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, police officers of the group Fantom 509 carried out acts of vandalism such as smashing car windows and slashing tires, in demonstration of the arrest of a police officer. [size=no report]

On 15 May 2020, in Carrefour, Ouest department, police officers of the group Fantom 509 carried out acts of vandalism such as smashing car windows and slashing tires, in demonstration of the arrest of a police officer. [size=no report]

On 14 May 2020, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest department, women protested at the courthouse during the trial of the President of the Haitian Football Association. The President is accused of having sexually abused female football players. [size=no report]

On 14 May 2020, in Thomonde, Centre department, inhabitants of the town blocked the highway to demonstrate against the fact that they had been without electricity for a number of days. [size=no report]
On 14 May 2020, in Hinche, Centre, a demonstration by the residents against the lack of electricity turned into a clash between police officers and residents. [size=no report]
Around 13 May 2020 (week of), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, a man was attacked by a mob who accused him of witchcraft. 0 fatalities. [size=no report]
Around 14 May 2020 (as reported), in Jacmel, Sud-Est department, a man was lynched by a mob for unknown reasons. [size=no report]

On 11 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, police officers of the Fantom 509 group demonstrated violently against the arrest and alleged placement in solitary confinement of a member of their group. The demonstrators set cars on fire along the road. [size=no report]

On 11 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, dozens of employees of the Ministry of Social Affairs and Labour protested to demand 24 months of pay in arrears. Protesters smeared fecal matter on the gate to the office of the Ministry. Police intervened with teargas. [size=dozens]

On 11 May 2020, in Miragoane commue, Nippes department, young people organized a sit-in in front of public institution in Source Salee to protest unfair practices of clientelism and favouritism by these institutions. [size=no report]
On 10 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, the office of the human rights group RNDDH was shot at multiple times by unknown assailants during the night.
On 8 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, a government employee was shot dead in a drive-by shooting by individuals traveling on a motorcycle. 1 fatality.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 8 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of a gang led by Micanor Altes, allied to Ti Junior, killed a gang leader from Fort Dimanche and his wife. Ti Junior had approached him earlier for an alliance but he had refused. 2 fatalities.
On 6 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, a journalist was shot and wounded trying to cover the gang violence in the southern parts of the city. 0 fatalities.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 5 May 2020, in Delmas, Ouest, heavily armed individuals and police officers broke into a house. In the presence and under orders of a judge, they proceeded to beat three individuals severely before arresting them and taking them to a courthouse. No fatalities.
On 5 May 2020, in Petion-Ville, Ouest department, a man was tied up and brutally beaten by police officers. The man has been involved in a land dispute for some time.
On 1 May 2020, in Hinche, Centre, school teachers went on strike and barricaded themselves into an office of the Ministry of Education to protest against the lack of salary payment. [size=no report]

On 30 April 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, gang violence in the southern parts of the capital caused at least six deaths. Clashes between three gangs - Baz Pilat, Grand-Ravine and Baz 5 Secondes - over territory were the cause of the violence. On social media gang members posted videos showing mutilation of corpses. At least 6 fatalities.

On 30 April 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, two persons were killed by the Village de Dieu gang. Armed groups have also blocked the entry to the Portail de Leogane area of the capital with trucks and piles of burning tires. 2 fatalities.

On 30 April 2020, in Hinche, Centre, school teachers went on strike and barricaded themselves into an office of the Ministry of Education to protest against the lack of salary payment. Protesters also organized a sit-in outside the ministry. [size=no report]

On 29 April 2020, in Hinche, Centre, school teachers went on strike and barricaded themselves into an office of the Ministry of Education to protest against the lack of salary payment. [size=no report]
On 28 April 2020, in Demas, Ouest department, a journalist was severely beaten by police officers. The officers in question claim that the journalist hit them first, something the journalist denies.

On 28 April 2020, in Gonaives, Artibonite, paramedics and emergency workers vandalized a coronavirus-facility in the city, and beat up a security guard. The rioters overturned beds and destroyed beds. Furthermore, the striking healthcare workers blocked a road in the north of the city leading to traffic congestion. The rioters are demanding 36 months of payment which they claim they have not received. [size=no report]

On 27 April 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, a hundred of rioting police officers of a group called Fantom 509 broke down the gates of the Ministry of Economy and Finance and fired shots inside. In the parking lot they set cars on fire. The police officers were demonstrating against lacking payment and bad working conditions. [size=a hundred]

On 27 April 2020, in Delmas, Ouest department, demonstrating police officers affiliated with Fantom 509 clashed with on-duty police in an armoured vehicle which was preventing the rioters to go to the house of the Prime Minister of Haiti. Heavy gunfire were exchanged. One demonstrator was wounded. A hundred police demonstrators slashed tires, shot in the air, threw tear gas and erected barricades, and attacked the office of an insurance company, as part of a demonstration against bad working conditions. [size=a hundred]

On 27 April 2020, in Hinche, Centre, a few dozen government employees went on strike, and gathered in the courtyard, protesting against the lack of payment for their work for the past 15 months. [size=a few dozen]

On 26 April 2020, in Jeremie, Grand'Anse, police officers violently dispersed a crowd of people who were not respecting the coronavirus curfew, leading to an altercation between the crowd and police. [size=no report]
On 25 April 2020, in Jeremie, Grand'Anse, at least ten officers handcuffed and beat up two men who did not respect the coronavirus curfew. No fatalities.
On 24 April 2020, in Jeremie, Grand'Anse, police officers beat up shopkeepers and customers for not respecting the coronavirus curfew. No fatalities reported.

On 23 April 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several dozens merchants protested against the decision to limit the number of market days to prevent the spread of coronavirus. Police used tear gas on the protesters to disperse them. [size=several dozens]
On 20 April 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police in armoured vehicles intervened against the Grand-Ravine Gang who were blockading traffic. 0 fatalities.

On 20 April 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, heavy gunfire was exchanged between rival gangs in the southern part of the city again. Burning barricades were constructed by the Baz Pilat Gang, but it unclear if they were involved in the battle. No fatalities reported.
On 14 April 2020, in Port-au-Prince, gang members from Village de Dieu killed six people. The aftermath was filmed and posted on social media by gang leaders. 6 fatalities.
Haiti Press Network; Le Nouvelliste; Tikozepam; Haiti Standard

In the night of 13 to 14 April 2020, in Cap-Haitien, Nord department, armed men attacked the house of a former parliamentarian and once presidential candidate's wife and killed a relative. One family member is missing, sparking fears of a kidnapping. 1 fatality.
On 13 April 2020, in Port-au-Prince, the Baz Pilat Gang killed six members of the Gran-Ravin Gang. 6 fatalities.
On 9 April 2020, in Fort Liberte, Nord-Est, a group of locals armed with sticks and machetes prevented a family from burying their deceased relative who passed away from coronavirus. [size=no report]

On 8 April 2020, outside of Saint-Marc, Artibonite, the host of a political radio show was attacked by armed persons who threw projectiles at him. The same radio personality was arrested last week and released shortly after.

On 6 April 2020, in Cap-Haitien, Nord department, hundreds of merchants protested against the closure of the Cluny market in downtown Cap-Haitien. The market was being closed down due to coronavirus. [size=hundreds]

On 3 April 2020, in Port-au-Prince, a radio personality was arrested after he made comments about coronavirus. Dozens of listeners showed up outside of the police station to protest the man's arrest, after which he was released. [size=dozens]

On 3 April 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, a recording artist was arrested by police, and subsequently released after a group of people gathered outside the police station to demand the release. [size=no report]
Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
On 29 March 2020, in Moreau, near Petite-Riviere, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang kidnapped and killed a truck driver.
On 28 March 2020 in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, doctors went out on the street to protest after the director of their hospital was kidnapped. [size=no report]
Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
On 27 March 2020, in Petite Riviere, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang killed three persons.

On 24 March 2020, in Leogane, Leogane region, a group of tens of Chrstian devotees took to the streets in protest after their pastor was arrested for holding mass with big groups despite coronavirus regulations. [size=tens]
On 20 March 2020, a state of emergency was declared in Haiti, closing the country's borders and airports and imposing a curfew on its citizens to prevent the spread of coronavirus.
On 19 March 2020, in Limonade, Haiti, the first coronavirus case in the country was attacked by individuals armed with machetes who attempted to lynch him. [size=no report]

As reported on 17 March 2020, demonstrators blockaded the street near Jacmel, Haiti, demanding the reperation of the road. They further threw bottles and stones at passing cars. This is the second day of demonstrations. [size=no report]
On 16 March 2020, near Carrefour, Port au Prince, armed clashes between rival gangs were reported. It is unclear if there were fatalities.

As reported on 16 March 2020, demonstrators blockaded the street near Jacmel, Haiti, demanding the reperation of the road. They further threw bottles and stones at passing cars. This is the first day of demonstrations. [size=no report]

On 13 March 2020, in Delmas, Port au Prince, hooded agents of the USGPN entered the Ecole Normale Superieure where they threw smoke grenades and used violence against teachers. No motivation was reported.
On the night of 13 to 14 March 2020, in Gonaives, a police operation resulted in the death of three armed men. 3 fatalities.
On March 12, 2020, in Delmas, Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a Haitian senator's car was stopped, the senator was beaten and tied up by police in Fragneau Ville.
On 12 March 2020, in Port-au-Prince, a man was kidnapped by at least two people who got out of a government vehicle.

On 11 March 2020, south of Port-au-Prince, demonstrators blocked the road and slashed the tires of trucks. Demonstrators demanded the completion of a hospital which is under construction. [size=no report]
On 11 March 2020, south of Port-au-Prince, clashes between rival armed gangs were reported. No report of injured or fatalities.
Around 10 March 2020 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the 400 Mawozo Gang killed three people in Lilavois 39. 3 fatalities.

On 10 March 2020, in Port-au-Prince, police demonstrated for the second day for their right to unionize. The police attacked cars and set fire to tires which they used as barricades as well as using tear gas on government buildings. [size=dozens]
On 9 March 2020, in Port-au-Prince, police demonstrated for their right to unionize. Demonstrators attacked government cars, including one carrying a judge. [size=no report]
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 9 March 2020, in Tabarre, Ouest, armed men attacked a judge who was on his way home from the airport and attempted to kidnap him. The kidnapping failed and the car was hit several times by bullets. No fatalities.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 9 March 2020, in Delmas, Ouest, individuals dressed as police officers attacked a judge. Another judge was physically assaulted by unknown individuals. No fatalities.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 9 March 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a judge and a magistrate were attacked by unidentified individuals. No fatalities.
On 6 March 2020, in Ganthier, Croix-des-Bouquets, a Dominican taxi driver was killed by members of the 400 Mawozo gang. Motive unknown. 1 fatality.
On 5 March 2020, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, a private security guard was shot dead by three armed people. Motive unknown. 1 fatality.
On 2 March 2020, in Petion Ville, Ouest, a bailiff was shot dead by unknown perpetrators in the proximities of the court. Motive unknown. 1 fatality.
On 2 March 2020, in Petion-Ville, armed individuals shot and killed a bailiff near the Peace court. 1 fatality.
On 1 March 2020, in Jeremie, Grand'Anse, two gangs exchanged fire in the Saint Helene and Platon neighbourhoods. Several people resulted wounded. No fatalities were reported.

On 29 February 2019, in Boucan Carre, Centre, a crowd of residents lynched four people previously arrested for kidnapping in the Plateau Central neighbourhood. The mob took them out of their cells and set them on fire. 4 fatalities. [size=no report]
On 29 February 2019, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Krache Dife gang shot four men dead. Motive unknown. 4 fatalities.

On 24 February 2020, in Port-au-Prince, police officers and others demonstrated for a police union, setting up barricades on the main roads around the city. The Ministry of Justice and Security denounced the police action calling it an attempted coup d'etat. [size=no report]

On 23 February 2020 in Port-au-Prince, a radio station was vandalized; vehicles set on fire and windows broken. This happened during the ongoing police demonstration was but is unclear if the events are linked. [size=no report]

On 23 February 2020, in Port-au-Prince, hundreds of people, including bikers, uniformed police, and hooded individuals demonstrated for a new police union and then destroyed carnival decorations in the city. The military arrived and there was a clash between military and police, with firearms, automatic rifles, Molotov cocktails, and tear gas. One police officer, one soldier and a civilian were killed and one about ten others were injured. [size=no report]
On 20 February 2020, in Delmas, Port-au-Prince, a former deputy was kidnapped and a ransom was asked by the kidnappers.

On 19 February 2020 in Port-au-Prince, several hundred people, bikers, police officers, and armed men, demonstrated in the street, against statements made against the police and their union by government officials. [size=several hundred]

On 19 February 2020 in Cap-Haitien, a group of armed and hooded individuals dressed in black fired shots by the cathedral, the city hall, and other public buildings. There were reports of public panic downtown but no injuries. [size=no report]
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network; Le Nouvelliste

On 19 February 2020, in Port-au-Prince, the office of the president of the human rights organization Fondation Je Klere: FJKL was vandalized, burning tires left by the entrance, six vehicles and a generator were set on fire, there were bullet holes, rocks, and glass around the building. The FJKL president had been vocal against the creation of the union for police officers.

On 19 February 2020 in Port-au-Prince, more than a few dozen demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires and filled the sidewalks with stones around town, demonstrating against the carnival being held while the population lives in misery and crime is rampant. [size=more than a few dozen]

On 17 February 2020 in Port-au-Prince, about one hundred police officers demonstrated demanding the recognition of their union. During the demonstration, shots were fired and carnival stands set on fire. On February 18, five police officers were dismissed. [size=about 100]
On 17 February 2020 in Carrefour, a police inspector was shot and killed by unidentified perpetrators.
On 14 February 2020, in Port-au-Prince, demonstrators set road blocks made of tires on fire as part of demonstrations against insecurity and the current government. [size=no report]
Police Forces of Haiti (2017-) Prison Guards
On 14 February 2020 in Port-au-Prince, a lawyer was physically attacked by five police officers from the civil prison when he went to meet with three defendants.

On 13 February 2020 in Fonds Parisien, residents blocked the Malpasse road, protesting the arrest of a Haitian man there the day before. The police suspected the owner of a hardware store of involvement in drug trafficking and confiscated his money when he tried to cross the border. [size=no report]
On 12 February 2020, in Fontamara, Carrefour, and Martissant, Port-au-Prince, more than one thousand people protested against insecurity and kidnappings. [size=more than one thousand]

On 12 February 2020, in Port-au-Prince, dozens of students and other activists demonstrated against insecurity, kidnappings, and carnival organization. They attacked some scaffolding and clashed with the police, who sprayed teargas to disperse the crowd. [size=dozens]

On 12 February 2020 in Fonds Parisien, residents blocked the Malpasse road, protesting the arrest of a Haitian man that same day. The police suspected the owner of a hardware store of involvement in drug trafficking and confiscated his money when he tried to cross the border. [size=no report]
On 10 February 2020, in Martissant, Port-au-Prince, a man was killed when he went to pay ransom for five young church members who had been kidnapped on February 9. The five were not released.

On 10 February 2020, in Mirebalais, several dozens of people marched to protest the murder of a journalist in October. The police intervened throwing tear gas at the protesters, and two of them were injured. [size=several dozen]
On the weekend of 08 and 09 February 2020, in Canaan, Port-au-Prince, there was a shootout between rival gangs, four presumed gang members are dead and several civilians injured.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 07 February 2020, in Port-au-Prince, as one of the creators of the movement for a police union was called into the National Police General Inspectorate (PNH) to defend the union, a clash with shots fired inside the PNH was reported.
On 03 February 2020 in Hinche, the two small children of a preacher were kidnapped for ransom, but he cannot pay and has asked for help.
Police Forces of Haiti (2017-) Prison Guards

On 28 January 2020 in Port-au-Prince, the area around the national prison was blocked by police as shots were being fired inside, prisoners had obtained a gun and threatened prison guards in an attempt to escape. No one was injured and no prisoners escaped. [size=no report]
On 27 January, in Tabarre, Port-au-Prince, a police officer was shot and killed in Torcelle by armed men. 1 fatality.

On 27 January 2020 in Saint-Marc, a teenager was killed and two men injured by bullets during a clash between police and an armed group called 7 Seconds, when the police arrested one of the group members.
On 23 January 2020, in Port-au-Prince, a former police officer was shot and killed by armed men with his daughter in Croix-des-Bouquets. 2 fatalities.

On 21 January 2020 in Port-au-Prince, in the same area that gangs clashed on January 18, a clash between unidentified groups left at least three people injured with gunshot wounds, one of them a special police agent.

On 18 January 2020 in Port-au-Prince, persons from the Village de Dieu gang attacked persons from the Baz Pilate gang who were hiding in the Cite l_ternel neighbourhood. At least three people are dead, several are injured and four houses were set on fire.
On 16 January 2020 in Martissant, Port-au-Prince, a known lawyer was shot and killed in his car by members of the Grand Ravine gang.
On 12 January 2020 in Port-au-Prince, a man was killed by the police, he was suspected of having killed a policeman on January 11.

On 07 January 2020, between La Vallee and Bainet, one man was shot and killed and two others injured by an armed group in a car during an attempted kidnapping. They took one man with them in the car, shooting at bystanders. The kidnapped man was subsequently released.
On 07 January 2020 in Port-au-Prince, a judge was shot and killed by unidentified persons. They took some of his money and his motorcycle and escaped from the scene.
On 05 January 2020 in Croix-des-Bouquets, a US citizen was rescued by the police from a presumed kidnapping by two individuals who carried military badges and firearms. The two were arrested.

On 4 January 2020, in Gonaives, Artibonite, bus drivers blocked the national highway #1 for several hours, demonstrating against the murder of a bus driver on January 3, presumably by the Savien gang. [size=no report]

On 04 January 2020 in Port-au-Prince, there was a clash between local gangs, one of them led by Ti Joseph, the new leader after Ti Hougan. Approximately 6 or 7 people were killed by bullets and several others injured.

On 3 January 2020, in Gonaives, a bus driver was attacked and killed, presumably by members of the Savien gang, while driving the bus from Port-au-Prince. There were about ten passengers on the bus, some of them were also seriously injured.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On 02 January 2020 in Anse-Au-Pitre, outside Belle-Anse by the border, two police officers were injured and the police station set on fire when a group of rioters demonstrated against the police killing a youth. Some police agents escaped across the border to Pedernales and were protected by Dominican police. [size=no report]

On 01 January 2020 in Gonaives, there were protests in connection with the celebration of Independence Day. Opposition leaders and supporters gathered to attend the funeral of an anti-government protester and carried his coffin through the streets as more protesters joined them. [size=no report]
On 31 December 2019, in Port-au-Prince, a bailiff was shot and killed by armed individuals outside the Palace of Justice in Bicentenaire. 1 fatality.
On 27 December 2019 in Gonaives, several protesters marched in the streets, demanding the resignation of the president and protesting his visit to the city. [size=no report]

On 27 December 2019 in Saint-Marc, several demonstrators set up barricades blocking the road, demanding the resignation of the president. Police used teargas to disperse them and clear the road. [size=no report]
On 26 December 2019 in Petite-Riviere de l_rtibonite, at least two people were injured by bullets in a shootout between the Savien and Kafon Pey gangs.
On 24 December 2019 in Port-au-Prince, three people were kidnapped, the widows and son of well known former political activists, they were released on ransom on December 29.
Police Forces of Haiti (2017-) Prison Guards

On 18 December 2019 in Hinche, 550 prisoners attempted to break out of the prison, they took control from two prison guards and used their weapons and ammunition. Agents from l_nite departementale de maintien d_rdre (Udmo) surrounded the prison, and gunshots were fired from both sides. [size=550]
On 15 December 2019 in Pont-Sonde, a man was shot and killed by the drug trafficking police, who claimed he had a gun, while other witnesses say he was just a passer-by mistaken for a gang member.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 14 December 2019, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gangsters led by Jimmy Cherizier (Delmas 6 gang) and Ti Junior invaded the Nan Tokyo and killed five people, whom they beheaded. Afterwards their bodies were set on fire. 5 fatalities.

On 13 December 2019 in Miragoane, hundreds of people marched the street, demanding freedom for activists and the resignation of the president. Downtown, they threw rocks at public buildings. [size=hundreds]

On 10 December 2019 in Port-au-Prince, four armed men attacked the residence of a counselor to the president. His daughter and doorman both suffered gunshot wounds. The attackers also ransacked the house.

On 07 or 08 December 2019 in Fond-Parisien, one person died and several others were injured in a police operation during the weekend to dismantle a smuggler gang, where they also arrested at least 10 people.
On 08 December 2019 in Cap-Haitien, a policeman was shot and killed by unidentified armed attackers while he was driving back from a police operation downtown.

On 06 December 2019 in Port-au-Prince, over a hundred protesters marched from the airport towards the US embassy, demanding the president_ resignation as a high-level US representative was visiting. [size=over a hundred]

On 5 December 2019, in Port-au-Prince, dozens of people gathered in front of the French Embassy to denounce the embassy's cooperation and support for the current government that they consider corrupted. [size=dozens]
On 05 December 2019, in Gonaives, thousands of people protested, demanding the unconditional resignation of the president. [size=thousands]
On 04 December 2019 in Gonaives, some hundred protesters marched, demanding peace to be restored, and schools and businesses to reopen. [size=100]

On 2 December 2019 in Port-au-Prince, there was a shootout between rival gangs in the Carrefour-Feuille area. One projectile hit a woman in the face as she was praying in a church. She was not fatally injured.

RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

When the gang started working on removing barricades set up by local demonstrators, they were met with resistance, they fired at people, killing one woman who was selling bread on the street, injuring several others, also setting fire to eleven vehicles, twenty houses, and destroying two electric transformers.

On September 27, 2019, in Les Cayes, there were demonstrations against the president which started out peacefully but later some demonstrators armed with guns and knives pillaged shops, threw rocks at gas stations, and attempted to attack a police station. [size=no report]
On September 27, 2019, in Leogane, there were demonstrations against the president with reports of violence. [size=no report]

On September 27, 2019, in Cap-Haitien, there was a clash between two groups when demonstrators set fire to houses belonging to an armed group. At least 20 people were injured, 15 of them with gunshot wounds. This happened in the context of demonstrations against the president where thousands of people participated. [size=thousands]

On September 27, 2019, in Jacmel, there were demonstrations against the president with reports of violence. The courthouse was set on fire and five people were injured by gunshots and one with knife wounds. [size=no report]
On September 27, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, there were demonstrations against the president with reports of violence and pillaging. [size=thousands]
On September 27, 2019, in Jeremie, there were demonstrations against the president with reports of violence, two demonstrators injured with knife wounds. [size=no report]

On 27 September 2019, in Petit-Goave, a motorcycle taxi driver was shot and killed during anti-government demonstrations. The demonstrators went to the courthouse to demand justice for the killing and they set the building on fire. It was completely burnt as there is no fire department in the area. [size=no report]
On September 27, 2019, in Mirebalais, there were demonstrations against the president with reports of violence. [size=no report]
On September 27, 2019, in Petion-ville, at least three people were shot and injured when a car opened fire on anti-government demonstrators. [size=no group]
On September 27, 2019, in Petit-Goave, there were demonstrations against the president with reports of violence. [size=no report]
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 27 September 2019, in Thomonde, demonstrators attacked the local police station and set on fire three vehicle. One was belonging to the police institution. [size=no report]

On September 27, 2019, in Gonaives, there were demonstrations against the president, demonstrators attempted to attack public buildings and put up burning barricades. Police answered with teargas and gunshots, at least one person was injured. [size=no report]

On September 27, 2019, in Saint-Marc, there were demonstrations against the president, demonstrators attempted to attack shops, banks, and a police station. Police answered with throwing stones and bottles, teargas and gunshots. [size=no report]
Alterpresse; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 27 September 2019, in Port-au-Prince, demonstrators vandalised and set the offices of the police forces (Udmo and Pnh) on fire as part of anti-government demonstrations in cite Soleil. [size=no report]

On 27 September 2019, in Saint-Marc, demonstrators reportedly vandalised the police station of Frecyneau as part of anti-government demonstrations. [size=no report]
On 27 September 2019, in Petit-Goave, a demonstrator was shot and killed during a police intervention. [size=no report]
On September 26, 2019, in Ennery, a man was shot and killed during a police operation to reestablish order in the area after an armed attack on a deputy commissioner from the prosecutor's office.

On September 25, 2019, in Miragoane, there was a sit-in protest against the government, who the protesters accused of, among other things, corruption, high cost of life, impunity and injustice. [size=no report]
On 25 September 2019, in Carrefour, demonstrators set tires on fire as part of anti-government demonstrations. [size=no report]

On September 25, 2019, in Gressier, a student was shot and killed by an unidentified group, sources say he was traveling in a bus close to where a group of rioters had barricaded the road, and that these fired the shots that killed him. [size=no report]

On 25 September 2019, in Petion-Ville, armed individuals tried to set the house of a journalist from Radio Tele Kiskeya on fire. The brother of the journalist was at home at the time of attack, but was unharmed. The vehicle bearing the logo of the radio was vandalised.

On September 25, 2019, in Leogane, there were demonstrations against the government, the demonstrators paralyzed the national highway no.2, erecting barricades of burning tires, throwing tree branches, rocks and bottles. [size=no report]
On September 25, 2019, in Arcahaie, anti-government demonstrators blocked a road. The police intervened and shot at the demonstrations. A local man was shot dead. [size=no report]

On September 25, 2019, outside Ennery, there was a clash between anti-president demonstrators and a deputy commissioner. He was trying to drive into Ennery to buy gasoline, and attempted to use his gun to disperse the demonstrators blocking the road, but one of them grabbed the gun and shot and injured both the commissioner and his driver. [size=no report]

On September 25, 2019, in Saint Marc, several people were injured during demonstrations against the president. One man was shot in the head by a person on a motorbike. Police are reported to have fired shots and used teargas against rioters. [size=no report]

On 25 September 2019, in Port-au-Prince, demonstrators set tires on fire as part of anti-government demonstrations. A gas station on the road to the airport was also set on fire and several roads were blocked. Rocks were thrown at the vehicles who tried to go through barricades. [size=no report]
On September 24, 2019, in Saint Marc, about ten people are reported to have sustained gunshot injuries by the police during demonstrations against the government. [size=about ten]

On September 23, 2019, in Petion-Ville, Port-au-Prince, there were demonstrations against the government during the tensions around the ratification of a new prime minister. Demonstrators pillaged a shop and attempted to vandalize the hotel where the ratification was to be held. [size=no report]
On 23 September 2019, in Petion-Ville, the building where a bank is located was set on fire and vandalised as part of anti-government demonstrations. [size=no report]
On 23 September 2019, in Jeremie, anti-governments protests were registered. [size=no report]
On 23 September 2019, in Mirebalais, anti-governments protests were registered. [size=no report]

On September 23, 2019, in Gonaives, a group of demonstrators set fire to the medical clinic belonging to the Senate President. They then set out for his home, but were hindered by the police. [size=no report]

On September 23, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, two men were shot and injured by a senator from the North outside the Parliament, during the tensions around the ratification of a new prime minister. Of the two injured, one was a journalist and the other a Parliament employee.

On September 23, 2019, in Cap-Haitien, thousands of people demonstrated against the President of the Republic. They have attacked homes, gas stations, public buildings, a school belonging to an MP, and an office belonging to a senator. [size=thousands]
On September 20, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, a journalist was shot and killed, and two others injured, by unidentified shooters who came out of a car, fired shots, and left.

On September 20, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, hundreds of demonstrators marched, demanding the resignation of the President. At one point they were blocked by a police cordon, then they threw stones at the police, who answered with teargas. [size=hundreds]
On September 19, 2019, in Tabarre, a police agent was shot and killed by unidentified shooters.

On September 19, 2019, in Ganthier, a man was shot and killed, witnesses say by a police officer. It happened while demonstrators were demanding a river be cleared up after a flood, throwing stones towards the police. [size=no report]
On September 17, 2019, in Canaan, Port au Prince, a policeman was shot and killed as he was entering his home. Reports suggest he was killed by gang members who control the area.

On September 17, 2019, in Port au Prince, there were protests against the fuel shortage. Some roads were blocked with burning tires and the city is reported to be paralyzed by the lack of fuel and demonstrations. [size=no report]

On September 16, 2019, in Port au Prince, there were demonstrations against the fuel shortage. There were reports of gunfire and clashes between demonstrators and police, barricades blocking main roads and preventing traffic, and vandalizing of cars and businesses. [size=no report]
On September 16, 2019, in Cayes, a 6-year-old child was shot and injured in his home as a police officer fired his gun.

On September 16, 2019, in Jacmel, two journalists were attacked by a group of three people, one of them stabbed with a knife in the back, the other one hit in the face, as they were reporting on the fuel shortage protests.
On September 16, 2019, in Cap-Haitien, there were protests against the fuel shortage. [size=no report]
On September 16, 2019, in Les Cayes, there were protests against the fuel shortage. [size=no report]
On September 16, 2019, in Saint-Marc, there were protests against the fuel shortage. [size=no report]

On September 16, 2019, in Carrefour, a man was killed during a police intervention in a demonstration against fuel shortage. The demonstrators are reported to have thrown rocks at the police and the police fired teargas, arrested two people, and some people were injured. Reports suggest the man killed was not involved in the demonstration. [size=no report]

On September 16, 2019, in Gonaives, hundreds of people protested against the fuel shortage, demanding the resignation of the President over his lack of reaction to the crisis. Among the protesters were motorcycle drivers and professors. [size=several hundred]
