Around 16 September 2019 (as reported), in Gonaives, Artibonite, heavily armed individuals opened fire on the home of the magistrate of the Gonaives Court of Appeal, hitting his son three times. No fatalities.
On 15 September 2019, in Petion-Ville, Port-au-Prince, people set tires on fire as part of anti-government demonstrations. [size=no report]
On 15 September 2019, in Delmas, Port-au-Prince, people set tires on fire as part of anti-government demonstrations. [size=no report]
On 15 September 2019, in Port-au-Prince, unions and social movement set tires on fire in several area of the city as part of anti-government demonstrations. [size=no report]

On September 11, 2019, in Port au Prince, locals erected barricades of burning tires and are reported to have committed vandalism, fired guns and had violent clashes with the police. Then they entered the Senate and destroyed things inside.
On September 11, 2019, in Petion-Ville, an off-duty policeman was killed by unidentified shooters, shot in the head on his way home from a football match.

On 10 September 2019, in Cap-Haitien, motorcycle taxi drivers demonstrated against the fuel shortage crisis. They made burning barricades, threw stones and bottles and hindered traffic into the city. [size=no report]

On September 10, 2019, at Cabaret, the national road # 1 was blocked by citizens demanding the repair of Damier Bridge, preventing traffic from the North region to reach the rest of the country. [size=no report]

On September 10, 2019, in Petite-Riviere de l_rtibonite, there was a clash and shootout between gangs from two different neighborhoods: Savien and Jean-Denis. A member of one gang is said to have been kidnapped, killed and burnt by the other gang, four other people are said to have been killed, but it is not confirmed, and two gang members injured. Fatalities: 5
On 10 September 2019, in Port-au-Prince, several dozens of teachers marched to demand measures to improve teaching conditions and quality. [size=several dozens]

On September 9, 2019, in Miragoane, a group of teachers held a sit-in protest organized by a platform for various teachers_unions, demanding among other things better pay, better work conditions and social benefits. [size=no report]

On September 04, 2019, motorists and other people continued their demonstrations against fuel shortages at gas stations and rising gas prices, which brought daily and economic life to a halt. Demonstrators built barricades from tires and set fire to them. [size=no report]

On September 04, 2029, a radio journalist was assaulted by 5 suspected police officers in the Turgeau area of Port-au-Prince. The police officers were in a vehicle with no doors and no license plates. They also stole 3550 gourdes from the journalist. No fatalities were reported.

On September 04, 2019, a group of young men built barricades in several main roads in the city of Les Cayes, in addition to throwing stones at people. This brought the city to a standstill as people feared going out and businesses closed. The police unblocked some of the roads, but didn't intervene to stop the violence.

On September 03, 2019, the deputy of the OPL and a party member of Fanmi Lavalas, both members of the opposition, ransacked the sitting room of the Lower House in order to block the ratification of the general policy of the the newly appointed Prime Minister, Fritz William Michel, which was due to take place in the Lower House several hour later.

On September 03, 2019, 2 young men, suspected of being members of Bwadom Gang, were attacked with stones and sticks by a group of young people in front of Parliament and Place d'Italie in Port-au-Prince. The two men died from injuries sustained during the attack. They were allegedly attacked by victims of the 2018 La Saline Massacre. The attack took place as 3 police officers arrived in the area, but didn_ intervene to stop the attack.
On September 03, 2019, a police officer was fatally shot in his vehicle at People's Street near Venezuela's National School in Port-Au-Prince.

On September 02, 2019, motorists and other people demonstrated against fuel shortages at gas stations and rising gas prices. They blocked major roads and highways in Port-au-Prince, including Delmas 105, Lalue, Delmas 60, l_venue Lamartinire, and La Route national #2. Demonstrators also built barricades from tires and set fire to them and threw stones at the police. [size=no report]

On September 02, 2019, residents of the Manquette of the commune of Ouanaminthe demonstrated against the lowering of electricity supplies to the area by two hours per day. They set up barricades of burning tires and threw stones with shards of glass bottles on the highway. [size=no report]

On September 1, 2019, in Port au Prince, outside the parliament building and in front of a police patrol who had been detaining him, a man was killed by a group of about ten men who attacked him with stones and sticks and broke his skull with a big rock. [size=no report]
On August 29, 2019, at Carrefour, about a hundred people from the city participated in a sit-in protest against insecurity, organized by the movement Kri Moun Kafou [size=about 100]

On August 29, 2019, at Plaisance, the National Road #1 was blocked by truck drivers from the evening until the next morning, parking the trucks across the road, not letting anyone pass. They are demanding the construction of a road through Limbe they claim the president had promised. [size=no report]

On August 28, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, there was a shootout between gangs. One source mentions the involvement of the Baz Pilate gang. Several people were reported injured. They shot at a fire truck that tried to enter an area controlled by gangs, killing one policeman.

On August 27, 2019, in Gonaives, taxi motorcycle drivers, frustrated with government restrictions, lack of gasoline and high fuel prices, attacked fuel retailers, the two groups were fighting and throwing stones at each other. [size=no report]
On August 26, 2019, in Port au Prince, some tens of students protested because their final exams had been postponed, blocking a street in front of a school. [size=tens]
Labour Group (Haiti); APCH: Association of Owners and Drivers of Haiti
On August 26, 2019, in Leogane, a man who was member of the APCH transport workers union, was shot and killed by unidentified persons on a motorcycle.
On 26 August 2019, in Leogane, a union leader for transportation workers was shot and killed by armed men on a motorbike. 1 fatality.
On August 23, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, public transportation workers and unions went on strike, marching and protesting against violence, impunity and insecurity. [size=no report]
On 22 August 2019, in Carrefour, Port-au-Prince, a national police officer was shot and killed.
On August 19, 2019, in Port au Prince, an armed group tried to divert a truck, shooting and injuring two people, one of whom the owner of the truck.
On August 18, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, close to an area where there has been a heavy presence of armed gangs, an member of parliament and his driver were both shot and injured.

On August 14, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, the party Pitit Dessaline organized a protest, where dozens of people celebrated the anniversary of the slave uprising and to continue to demand the resignation of the President. [size=tens]

On August 13, 2019, in three different areas of Port au Prince, in the afternoon, various gunshots were heard, creating panic among the population. Gangs are reported to be attempting to take control of the southern entrance to the city at Martissant.

August 12, 2019, in Port au Prince, groups of citizens were protesting in front of the parliament, demanding the president be charged with high treason. They were throwing rocks, and the police using tear gas against them. [size=no report]

On August 12, 2019, at Thomazeau, there was a confrontation between the _00 mawozo gang_and the 'Lanmo san jou' gang, presumably about one of the gangs kidnapping two civilians. The clash left at least eight people dead, among them a known gang leader. The dead bodies were decapitated and burnt.
On August 11, 2019, at Martissant, two men were killed, their bodies burnt, the killers escaped in the victims_car. One of the men was a policeman, who was off-duty.

August 8, 2019, in Martissant, a man was shot and killed, when unidentified armed persons told him to get out of his vehicle, but shot him before he could get out. The man was a known trade unionist in the public transport sector, these are said to be targeted by the armed groups in the area.
On 8 August 2019, in Port-au-Prince, a union leader for transportation workers was shot and killed in Martissant. 1 fatality.

August 7, 2019, at Poste Marchand in Port au Prince, a man who worked for the Ministry of Education was shot and killed. According to his children, he had been threatened earlier, and his possessions were not stolen.
August 6, 2019, in Leogane, a journalist was attacked by unidentified armed people who shot at him while he was in his car close to his house. The man had reported phone threats in previous weeks.
On 5 August 2019, in Port-au-Prince, a head of the gang Bwadom was arrested in Martissant.

On August 4, 2019, on the Dalles road in Port au Prince, a man was killed during a shootout between two armed groups. It is unclear whether he was part of either of the groups. The dead body was left on the road until August 6, when it was burned.

August 4, 2019, in Carrefour, tens of people participated in a protest march against road insecurity organized by Stop Accident in memory of a nurse killed on the road, including members of the Youth and Sports ministry. [size=tens]
August 3, 2019, in Martissant, there was a shootout with automatic guns between police and local armed groups. Reports say people are avoiding this area for panic of the shootouts.

August 2, 2019, in Grand Ravine, Port-au-Prince, a man identified as a bank employee was shot and killed after having been kidnapped from his car. Reports say he was driving through a dangerous zone with armed gangs.

On August 1, 2019, in Martissant, Port-au-Prince, a man was shot and killed while he was driving in his car. Reports say unidentified gunmen tried to make him stop the car but he tried to drive away. The victim was identified as a nurse.

On July 30, 2019, in Petit Goave, protesters who are reported to be members of the opposition, held a sit-in in front of the office of Electricity of Haiti (EDH), to protest a 15-day blackout. [size=no report]

On July 30, 2019, in Port au Prince, there was a shootout between police and members of the Village de Dieu Gang, when they stopped them from attacking a truck with goods. Reports say at least one civilian was injured by gun shot and that the civilian population in the area is in a state of panic.
On 30 July 2019, in Port-au-Prince, a police officer was shot and killed in Martissant. 1 fatality.
On July 25, 2019, in Port au Prince, a police officer was shot and killed by armed motorcyclists.

On July 22, 2019, at Cayes City, one of the country_ most wanted gang leaders was arrested at a hospital. He had been hiding out in the Artibonite area since November 2018, robbing cars and merchandise and kidnapping people.

On July 22, 2019, in Bassin Bleu, Port de Paix, people protested the murder of a policeman in the area on July 6th. They blocked a road, police intervened to disperse them and arrested two people. [size=no report]
On July 22, 2019, the prime minister of Haiti resigned after less than six months in office, after days of violent protests against fuel price rises.

On July 18, 2019, protesters gathered in front of the courthouse in Port au Prince to protest against the judge in the PetroCaribe case, they claim he is too close with the Tete Kale party. They also protested against the gang related violence and insecurity. [size=no report]

On July 16, 2019, at Delmas 60, Port au Prince, a journalist traveling by car was attacked by gunmen on a motorbike, who tried to make him stop the car and fired gunshots at it. The man did not stop and was not hit by bullets; only his car was. He claims he was attacked because of his journalism work.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 13 July 2019, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a meeting was held between high ranking gang members, including the Ti Junior leader, to appoint a new leader for the gang operating in the Nan Bwadom area. A heated argument broke out when one gang leader nominated himself but did not get support and 8 people died in the ensuing gun fight. 8 fatalities.

On July 10, 2019, at the Croix Des Bossales market in La Saline, Port au Prince, an unidentified armed group attacked merchants and customers, reports say four people are dead and three missing, but this has not been confirmed by the police. Human rights activists claim the attack was carried out by a gang lead by Jimmy Cherisier alias Barbecue.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 9 July 2019, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a gang based in La Saline and led by Joel Noel retaliated to an attack that took place in his neighbourhood on 5 April by attacking the territory held by Ti Junior and the Chabon Gang. Six people were killed. 6 fatalities.

On July 8, 2019, at Marchand Dessalines, a Chief police commissioner was shot by an unidentified shooter when he was traveling in his car, receiving injuries to the face from car glass breaking due to the gunshots.
Government of Haiti (2017-); Fanmi Lavalas; Democratic and Popular Sector

On July 6, 2019, on the Route des Dalles in Port-au-Prince, a car belonging to Lavalam Family MP Printemps Belizaire, was attacked by unidentified shooters, injuring the passenger, a member of the Secteur democratique et populaire. The MP claims he was the target for the shooters as he was supposed to be traveling in the car.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 5 July 2019, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, an attack by the Chabon Gang and led by Ti Junior in the La Saline neighbourhood caused six deaths. Two people went missing. 6 fatalities.
CROSE: Coordination Regionale des Organisations du Sud-Est

On 3 July 2019, thousands of protesters marched through Jacmel, in a march organised by CROSE, the Regional Coordination for Organizations of the South-East, on the last day of a three-day CROSE conference on governance and corruption. The protesters demands included the resignation and arrest of President Jovenel Moise over corruption charges, as well as better living conditions for the people. [size=thousands]

On 1 July 2019, a car belonging to a Renmen Ayiti MP from Plaisance du Sud, Claude Guillaume, with nine unidentified persons on board, fired shots at people who were behind a barricade, killing two. These are reported to be merchants and/or protesters for clean drinking water, between Petite-Riviere de Nippes and Anse-a-Veau. Unidentified people fired back, killing four of the nine, some reports say burned alive. The remaining five escaped, three were apprehended by police.

On 1 July 2019, the mayors of the towns Cap-Haitien, Quartier-Morin, and Limonade, together with other protesters, some of which also reported to be part of local government, blocked the highway N6 outside Limonade, protesting the plans to build a waste treatment facility there. [size=no report]
On June 27, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, a man was shot and killed by unknown armed men on motorcycles. One activist of the Esklav Revolte party said the killing was politically motivated.

On June 27, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, medical, dental and nursing students demonstrated in the streets against the poor health system and to demand the resignation of corrupt officials involved in the PetroCaribe scandal. [size=no report]
On June 26, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, several activists held a sit-in protest with placards in front of the parliament at the first opening of the National Assembly. [size=no report]

On June 26, 2019, in Chalon, Miragoane, Haiti, rioters clashed with the police as they were erecting burning barricades, after which police fired with live bullets, injuring three rioters. [size=no report]
Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang

On June 26, 2019, in Savien, Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Haiti, the local Gran Grif de Savien Gang clashed with the police when they attacked an armoured police vehicle, after which 2-3 gang members were killed.

On June 26, 2019, in Turgeau district, Port-au-Prince, Haiti, police fired with teargas to disperse demonstrators, mostly schoolchildren in uniform, who demanded the resignation of the president. [size=no report]

On the night of 26 to 27 June 2019, in Grand-Goave, Haiti, an unidentified group set fire to four government buildings. Reportedly this was related to the movement demanding the resignation of the president.
On June 24, 2019, in Saint-Marc, Haiti, students threw stones at several exam centres and destroyed exam sheets to boycott the national school exams. [size=no report]

On June 24, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, a minivan of Radio Tele Metropole was pelted with stones while driving on a road, resulting in several broken windows. Other vehicles of the radio station were targeted a week before, amidst a series of attacks on media in the country. The station is accused of being pro-government. [size=no report]

On 24 June 2019, in Port-au-Prince, burning tires were set as barricades as part of anti-government demonstrations. The police dispersed demonstrators with tear gas and shootings near the national palace. That day, 4 people were arrested on their way back from the demonstration. [size=no report]
On 24 June 2019, in Les Cayes, some people started a fire at the entrance of Radio Vwa peyizan Sid. The director condemned the action. [size=no report]
On 24 June 2019, in Port-au-Prince, people participating in anti-government demonstrations threw rocks at a car belonging to a news outlet where two journalists were travelling. [size=no report]
On June 23, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, protesters marched the streets to demand the resignation of the president, whom they accuse of corruption. [size=no report]

On June 23, 2019, in Gros-Morne, Haiti, dozens of protesters marched on the streets to demand the resignation of the president over his involvement in the PetroCaribe corruption scandal. The demonstration was dispersed by pro-government supporters who threw stones at them. [size=dozens]
On June 22, 2019, in Les Cayes, Haiti, an unidentified group set fire to the entrance of the VPS Radio station. Several other media organisations were targeted in the preceding weeks.

On June 19, 2019, in Bois-Verna neighbourhood, Port-au-Prince, Haiti, rioters vandalised three lottery stores belonging to the former presidential candidate after he had said he wanted to amnesty the current president in a corruption case. [size=no report]

On June 19, 2019, in Turgeau, Port-au-Prince, Haiti, several people on motorcycles threw stones at a car belonging to the Radio Tele Metropole media station, whom they accused of supporting the president. Several media and journalists have been targeted in the weeks before.

On June 19, 2019, in Trou-du-Nord, Nord, Haiti, local government delegates and supporters held a protest to demand the re-election of the parliament and the ratification of a treaty with Taiwan. [size=no report]

Between 17 and 19 June, 2019, in Village de Dieu, in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, rival gangs clashed in a firefight with automatic weapons over the territory of the debilitated Village de Dieu Gang (Arnel Joseph) gang. At least 5 people were reportedly killed, and 12 injured.

On June 18, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, gunmen fired at the building of the TV Zenith Radio station. No injuries were reported. Several media outlets and journalists have been targeted in the weeks before.

On June 18, 2019, in Leogane, Haiti, hundreds of demonstrators took to the streets to demand the resignation of the president who they accuse of corruption. Several rioters threw stones at cars and government building and erected burning barricades. Police responded by firing at them, wounding one. Several others were wounded by stones in an altercation with bikers who objected to the barricades. [size=hundreds]
On June 17, 2019, in Arcahaie, Haiti, a man was killed with stones and machetes by a group of people who accused him of having stolen bananas. [size=no report]
On June 17, 2019, in Gonaives, Haiti, protesters took to the streets to demand the resignation of the president whom they accuse of corruption. [size=no report]

On June 17, 2019, in Bois La Ville, Artibonite, Haiti, 8 people were killed, and several injured in a firefight between the Village de Dieu Gang and the Ti Sourit Gang. The leader of Village de Dieu Arnel Joseph was shot in the leg, and his driver and doctor were arrested the following day. Several of the wounded were civilians.

On June 17, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, dozens of protesters, many of whom journalists, held a silent march in solidarity with the journalist who was killed a week before, and other journalists attacked recently, to demand justice and security. [size=dozens]

On June 16, 2019, in Miragoane, Haiti, hundreds of demonstrators took to the streets to demand the resignation of the president whom they accuse of corruption. Several rioters attacked government buildings and threw stones at people on the roof, who responded by firing warning shots into the air. One person was injured. [size=hundreds]

On 16 June 2019, in Mirebalais, Centre, several thousand demonstrators took to the streets to demand the resignation of the president whom they accuse of corruption. Several rioters threw stones and erected burning barricades. One person was seriously injured. [size=several thousand]
On 16 June 2019, Les Cayes, several thousands of people marched as part of anti-government demonstrations. [size=several thousands]
On June 14, 2019, in Jacmel, Haiti, several protesters blocked a main road. Residents had been protesting for six days in a row to demand the resignation of the president. [size=several]

On June 14, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, rioters marched on the main square and threw several stones at passing cars. It was the second day of a protest organized to demand the resignation of the president over his involvement in a corruption case. [size=no report]
On June 14, 2019, in Hinche, Haiti, thousands of protesters with placards took to the streets to demand the resignation of the president. [size=thousands]

On June 14, 2019, in Les Cayes, Haiti, one rioter was killed and ten people were injured, and dozens arrested during shootouts between individuals and the police. Demonstrators had taken to the streets for the sixth consecutive day to demand the resignation of the president.

On June 13, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, nearly 2,000 people marched seven times around the National Palace demanding the resignation of the president, after which they erected barricades of burning tires, threw stones at vehicles and public institutions, and clashed with the police. On 13 November 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, five armed gangs (Chabon, Bwadom, Tokyo, Delmas 6 and Pilate) carried out a planned attack in the La Saline neighbourhood. The neighbourhood was allegedly targeted for its supposed affiliation to rival armed gangs. During the attack at least 26 residents were killed in their homes with guns, axes and machetes, and the attackers committed two gang rapes. 12 people remained missing seven months later and were feared dead. A UN report concluded that the attack had been ordered by government officials, and that several police officers took part in the attacks, in order to eliminate several gang members.

On 17 October 2018, thousands of people demonstrated in Cap-Haitien against the misuse of Petrocaribe funds. A government office was set on fire and one person was shot in the leg.

On 17 October 2018, thousands of people demonstrated in Port-au-Prince against the government's corruption in the case of Petrocaribe. Gunshots rang out while rioters threw rocks, blocked roads and burned tires to demand more transparency. One police officer and two civilians were injured, as police used tear gas to disperse a crowd throwing rocks at Hotel Kinam. Two people died after gunshots and around 14 others were injured.

On 17 October 2018, thousands of people took to the streets in the 3rd city of the country as part of the day of mobilization to ask the state authorities to account for the management of funds ''Petrocaribe''. A protester was killed in Les Cayes and pronounced dead once at the hospital. Protesters accused a city traffic police officer of shooting at the victim. Two others were reportedly wounded by bullet.
On 16 October 2018, five high school students were arrested in Port au Prince, Haiti during a demonstration to demand accountability over the PetroCaribe funds.

On 16 October 2018, the commissioner of Petion Ville and other police agents of the National Police of Haiti were attacked by armed men while attempting to break a barricade. Unidentified armed men opened fired on the their vehicle, injuring the chief of the commissioner. Motives are unknown.
On 16 October 2018, people built barricades in Port-au-Prince to demonstrate against the government's corruption. A Police officer was injured when they were trying to remove the barricades.

On 15 October 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, an unknown number of students staged a protest in front of the Marriott hotel to denounce the role of the government in the PetroCaribe corruption scandal. [size=no report]

On 12 October 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a high number of students from different schools in the city staged a protest to demand the rebuilding of their schools that have been damaged since the earthquake of 2010, and denouncing the role of the government in the PetroCaribe corruption case. Police forces fired tear gas at the protesters, paralyzing one student. [size=a high number]

On 11 October 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, an unknown number of representatives of unions, political and civil society organizations staged a sit-in protest in front of the Unite de Lutte Contre la Corruption to demand clarity on the corruption case around Petrocaribe. [size=no report]

On 9 October 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several dozen students staged a protest action during the 45th anniversary ceremony of the INFP, demanding better material and infrastructure, and the nomination of professors. [size=several dozen]
On 8 October 2018, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, an unknown number of CODEVI workers staged a protest to demand a higher minimum wage, up to 1000 gourdes. [size=no report]

On 8 October 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several hundred of workers staged a protest near the airport to demand a higher minimum wage and reject arbitrary dismissals. The protest was ended after unidentified perpetrators fired tear gas to the crowd. [size=several hundred]

On 5 October 2018, in Sainte-Suzanne, Nord-Est, at night before dawn, an unknown number of armed men penetrated the private residence of former Prime Minister Fritz Jean, beating up a small child who was the only one present.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 4 October 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), a police officer and a man discussed over a traffic fine. The police officer then took the man out of the car by force and officers beat him up severely and detained him. A friend of the beaten man tried to intervene and was also detained. At the police station, both of them were beaten up again.
On 4 October 2018, in Leogane, Ouest, an unknown number of supporters of an imprisoned former local deputy staged a protest to demand his release from prison. [size=no report]
On 3 October 2018, lawyers were physically assaulted and humiliated at Gerald-Bataille in Delmas by police officers. They were later locked up at the Delmas 33 police station where they were beaten.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 2 October 2018, in Tabarre (Port-au-Prince), the mayor of Tabarre accused her partner of beating her up when she decided not to hamper an investigation on corruption involving the previous administration.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 1 October 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), officers from the motorized intervention brigade detained three suspects. These three were then beaten up severely by the officers and one of them lost consciousness.

On 1 October 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the State Secretary of public security and former presidential candidate was shot while in his car and transferred to hospital. No information about attackers reported.

On 1 October 2018, in Grand-Goave, Ouest, the body of a man working as agronomy specialist for the Ministry of Agriculture was found in Grand-Goave, after he was reported missing on 28 September 2018. The body was mutilated by a machete. No information on the causes of the attack nor the perpetrators was reported.

On 1 October 2018, civil society organizations demonstrated in Petion-Ville in Port-au-Prince where the presidential family live. The demonstrators demanded better conditions of housing as required by the Constitution.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 30 September 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), a police officer tried to halt a motorcycle driver. When he kept driving, the officer shot, injuring both the driver and the passenger.

On 29 September 2018, a demonstration was dispersed by the police with tear gas in Tabarre. Demonstrators wanted to go to the private residence of the former Minister of Planning and Security asking for information about the PetroCaribe funds.

On 29 September 2018, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, an unknown number of armed individuals attacked 8 municipal workers cleaning the streets at night. One woman was killed, another heavily injured. Upon the attack, the security forces accompanying them ran away to seek help. Three suspects were arrested later that day.

On 29 September 2018, in Saint-Marc, Artibonite, an unknown number of people staged a demonstration against unfinished road construction works in their neighborhood causing floods. The demonstrators erected barricades of burning tyres on the Route Nationale 1. [size=no report]

Around 28 September 2018 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a dozen supporters of the PHTK party staged a sit-in protest upon the arrival of the President and fellow party member Moise at the airport to denounce the dismissal of the general director of the SMCRS and the fact that they weren't awarded with a position in Moise's administration. [size=a dozen]

Around 26 September 2018 (month of), in Leogane, Ouest, two business men were kidnapped by an unidentified armed group and taken to Grand-Ravine, Port-au-Prince, for a ransom. That day, a shop keeper was also kidnapped. The kidnappers asked for a ransom. The victim was released alive.

On 23 September 2018, a demonstration in Port-au-Prince called on the use of the PetroCaribe to fund regional economic organization brought several hundred participants to Port-au-Prince. Academics, human rights defenders and opposition figures were present in this event. As the procession arrived at Avenue Lamartiniere, some demonstrators took the opportunity to erect barricades of burning tires.

On 23 September 2018, in Dessalines, Artibonite, a group of people preparing a demonstration around the PetroCaribe corruption case was attacked during their meeting by a group with bottles and stones, resulting in one injured person. The group of assailants were allegedly supported by two local senators. [size=no report]

On 20 September 2018, in Jacmel, Sud-Est, an unknown number of Cavaly AS football supporters staged a protest to demand the liberation of one of their fellow supporters who was arrested the night before. They blocked National Road 2 by placing trucks horizontally on the tarmac. [size=no report]
On 20 September 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, an unknown number of workers staged a protest to demand a higher wage and clarity in the PetroCaribe corruption case. [size=no report]

On 19 September 2018, in Miragoane, Nippes, a young man was stabbed to death by two private security guards of a representative of the national palace in the Nippes region. The victim was a member of staff of the group Djol Boule, considered by the local authorities as a criminal gang.

On 18 September 2018, a demonstration was held in front of the premises of the Ministry of Cults in Port-au-Prince after the prophet, Mackenson Dorilas, was forbidden to speak in his church and on social networks until he presents the documents of his studies in theology.
On 16 September 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a police officer and several civilians were attacked and wounded by armed men on motorcycles (drive-by). No fatalities reported.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 15 September 2018, in Delmas municipality, Ouest, overnight, several armed men shot and killed 2 police officers after the officers shot and killed one of them during a traffic dispute. 3 fatalities.
On 15 September 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, two police officers died as a consequence of an armed clash following a traffic dispute.

On 13 September 2018, in Limbe, Nord, an unknown number of students and teachers staged a protest in several locations to demand electricity, infrastructural improvement and the official nomination of educational personnel. The protest was organized by the local teacher associations COPSELL and REAL. [size=no report]
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 11 September 2018, on the road Gonaives - Saint Marc (Artibonite), a police officer tried to halt a bus, which did not stop and, speeding up, hit and killed a woman. The police officer then shot at the bus and shot and killed another man.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 11 September 2018, in Gonaives (Artibonite), a police officer shot and killed a man under unclear circumstances.

On 10 September 2018, in Arcahaie municipality, Ouest, 8 armed individuals erected a road block on the Arcahaie road in Luly, shooting relentlessly, ordering people to leave their car and confiscating their car keys. At least two men were killed.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 9 September 2018, in Saint-Michel-de-l'Atalaye (Artibonite), three persons were detained by the police and severely beaten up. One of them died and the other two received long-term injuries.

On 9 September 2018, groups of people marched in Port-au-Prince to demonstrate against the government's corruption and demand investigations about the use of Petrocaribe funds turned into clashes with policemen. The police dispersed the demonstration blocking the march and using tear gas. Some of the demonstrators built barricades.

On 7 September 2018, members of the Konbit nasyonal party organized a peaceful demonstration in Jacmel to support Senator Joseph Lambert - founder of KONA - whose house was attacked by heavily armed individuals on the night of 28 August 2018. The demonstrators denounced the state authorities who did not respond appropriately to this attack on the residence of the Senate Speaker. [size=no report]

On 7 September 2018, a demonstration was held in Port-au-Prince to demand legal action against the alleged mismanagement of the PetroCaribe fund. Protesters blamed the leaders of the ruling party for using the funds made available to Haiti by Venezuela.

On 7 September 2018, in Leogane, Ouest, several hundreds of people staged a protest to denounce the PetroCaribe corruption case and several local problems. The protest was supported by many civil society organizations. [size=several hundred]

Around 6 September 2018 (week of), in Saint-Michel-de-l'Atalaye, Artibonite, an unknown number of people tried to set fire to the local police station after a man died shortly after he was detained. During the mob and after, gun shots were reported and one person injured. [size=no report]
On 5 September 2018, in Petion-Ville, Ouest, an armed clash took place when two presumed gang members opened fire at police officers, who reacted and killed both men on their motorbikes.
On 4 September 2018, in Gonaives, Artibonite, an unknown number of people staged a sit-in protest against police violence after a man was shot dead in the context of his arrest. [size=no report]
On 4 September 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a man was shot dead by an armed man on a motorbike (drive-by).
Around 4 September 2018 (as reported), an unknown number of people tried to besiege the commissariat of Saint-Marc after police forces killed a man accidentally. [size=no report]

On 4 September 2018, demonstrators set up burning barricades on the roadway in Gonaives, threatening to remain mobilized until they get justice and reparation for the death of one student. The student reached the hospital on Sept 3, as a victim of electrocution, and was not treated on time because medical staff went on strike.

On 3 September 2018, in Miragoane, Nippes, an unknown number of people staged a protest to the administrative center to demand the construction of a road in their neighborhood and access to drinking water, blocking the road on their way. [size=no report]

On 3 September 2018, employees of the National Center for Equipment have started a strike and blocked a national road in Port-au-Prince to denounce the poor working conditions in which they operate. They took the opportunity to claim the payment of salary arrears.

On 3 September 2018, several hundred of protesters walked in the capital of Port-au-Prince to demand information about the use of funds of PetroCaribe program. The demonstrators exhibited placards and posters in which they ask, among other things, accounts on the fund which the country has benefited since 2006. Young people, members of organizations trade unions, student organizations, popular organizations close to the opposition, academics, artists were seen at this march.

On 3 September 2018, students took to the streets to demand justice and reparation for the dead of one student at the Hospital of La Providence in Gonaives. Rioters claimed that those in charge of the hospitals are criminals, irresponsible, and that they serve only as a shelter for the corrupt. The police fired back with projectiles and tear gas grenades. Several people fainted and others went out injured. Unhappy with the reaction of the police, the students erected several fiery barricades. They threw a lot of stones at the police.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 2 September 2018, in Roseaux (Corail), a police officer who did not like the result of a soccer match started shooting at random with his gunshot. He shot and killed a man.

On 2 Septmber 2018, in Miragoane, Nippes, unidentified individuals set fire to the local headquarters of water service provider DINEPA and electricity provider EDH during the night, writing slogans against the lack of electricity and water provision in the neighborhood on the burnt walls. [size=no report]

On 31 August 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed clashes took place between police forces and unidentified gang members. No further information was reported. No fatalities neither injuries reported.

On 31 August 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a dozen people staged a sit-in protest in front of the Le Nouvelliste headquarters to denounce the socio-economically precarious conditions of many young people in Haiti. The protest was organized by the Kore Lavi platform. [size=a dozen]

On 29 August 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, residents of the southern exit of the Haitian capital, Martissant area blocked the road around the middle of the day. The traffic was paralyzed because people were demonstrating against the insalubrity of the area. [size=no report]
On 29 August 2018, in Les Cayes, Sud, an unknown number of people staged a protest to denounce the PetroCaribe corruption case. [size=no report]

On 29 August 2018, several union and student organizations demonstrated on the streets of the capital demanding accountability for the use of PetroCaribe funds. The march, initially peaceful, shifted when unidentified individuals among the crowd threw stones at the ministry. Some security officers responded to the throwing of stones. Two demonstrators were wounded, one in the face and the other in the leg. Angry, some rioters attacked windshields of vehicles parked in the area. Police threw back teargas. [size=no report]
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 28 August 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), a police officer tried to force a business man to close up his business in honour of a deceased officer. When he refused, the police officer attacked him with a bat and left him severely injured.
On 28 August 2018, the house of senator Joseph Lambert - founder of KONA, The Konbit National Party - was attacked by heavily armed individuals. The motives are unknown.

On 27 August 2018, in Miragoane, Nippes, an unidentified group of people vandalized the city hall of Miragoane, destroying windows by throwing rocks and bottles, after the mayor had arrested a man who had threatened him earlier that day.
Around 27 August 2018 (week of), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a grenade was thrown at the private residency of the Chairman of the Senate. A police officer was injured.
Around 27 August 2018 (as reported), in Jacmel, Sud-Est, a priest was attacked and almost beaten to death by members of an unidentified gang.
On 25 August 2018, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, several dozen of people staged a protest and sit-in to demand clarity on the public spending of the PetroCaribe funds by the government. [size=several dozen]
On 24 September 2018, several hundreds of people protested in Port-au-Prince against the lack of transparency and corruption of the Petrocaribe program.

On 21 August 2018, in Petion-Ville, Ouest, an unknown number of house owners of the Pelerin 5 quarter staged a protest to denounce the demolition of their properties by a governmental commissioner and demand a restitution from the state. The protesters were supported by several civil society organizations, notably the Bureau des Avocats Internationaux (BAI). [size=no report]

On 20 August 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several gun shots were fired and a tear gas grenade was thrown to the Parliament building early in the morning by unidentified people. No injuries. It is disputed whether the attack came from inside or outside the parliament.

On 20 August 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, two journalists were attacked by the security guards of the parliament when they tried to film a tense scene between the guards and Police officers. The guards were locking themselves into the Parliament to avoid an arrest in relation to a grenade attack on the parliament earlier that day. One journalist was injured and the equipment of another one destroyed.
On 18 August 2018, a group of people participated in riots after three wagonloads of cement crossed the border into the Haitian town of Belladere. The police confronted the rioters using tear gas.

On 16 August 2018, a peaceful march took place in the commune of Pont-Sonde, Artibonite.The purpose of the march was to demand justice and reparation for the damage caused by the ''Jasmine 85'' rice seed and the flood in the Artibonite Valley.

On 16 August 2018, a peaceful march took place in the commune of Petite-Riviere de the Artibonite. The purpose of the march was to demand justice and reparation for the damage caused by the ''Jasmine 85'' rice seed and the flood in the Artibonite Valley.

On 16 August 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, residents of Martissant blocked roads for two hours, creating a traffic jam. The protesters gave the authorities 72 hours to react and say what they will do about flooding in these slums after the rain. [size=no report]

On 14 August 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, an unknown number of voodoo followers staged a protest to demand a national holiday on 14 August, the day the voodoo ceremony of Bois-Caiman took place, leading to the Haitian revolution in 1791. [size=no report]

On 12 August 2018, there was a clash between students and police. The police was located at Christophe Avenue in Port-au-Prince to prevent students from go down the streets. Students launched provocative slogans and stones against the police and the police launched tear gas. After inhaling this harmful gas, nearly a dozen students, most of them girls, were rushed to hospital in an ambulance of the Haitian Red Cross. Several students were arrested.
On 12 August 2018, workers took to the streets of Port-au-Prince to continue their protest movement. Motives and demands are not specified.
On 7 August 2018, several civil society organizations marched in the streets of Port-au-Prince to denounce corruption and waste of public resources.

On 7 August 2018, for the second day of protest, activities at the University Hospital of Mirebalais, Central Department, were paralyzed, as health workers locked the access to the hospital. According to demonstrators, it has been several months since the hospital officials promise a salary adjustment.

On 6 August 2018, for the first day of protest, activities at the University Hospital of Mirebalais, Central Department, were paralyzed, as health workers locked the access to the hospital. According to demonstrators, it has been several months since the hospital officials promise a salary adjustment.

On 6 August 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several people from different organizations and students staged a protest in front of the rectorate headquarters of the State University of Haiti to demand the arrest of the dean of the ethnology faculty after he ran over a student the year before. [size=several people]

On 6 August 2018, in Leogane, Ouest, a man refused to stop at a police check and drove into a neighborhood with the Police chasing after him. There, a group of local residents attacked the police with gunshots and attempted to set the police vehicle on fire as they did not want the police present in their area. The police officers reacted with gunfire injuring 1 resident. After the police had left, a group of people blocked a road with burning tyres and started throwing stones to express their discontent with the police operation. [size=no report]

On 5 August 2018, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, a group of people staged a protest against lack of electricity services and to demand better infrastructure in their neighborhood. Police forces fired bullets and tear gas to the crowd, resulting in one injured person. [size=no report]

On 30 July 2018, in Arcahaie, Ouest, an armed clash took place between police forces and unidentified gang members who had just killed two municipal workers in the city hall (coded separately). One gang member was killed and one arrested, while the rest could escape.
Government of Haiti (2017-); PHTK: Haitian Tet Kale Party

On 30 July 2018, in Arcahaie, Ouest, two municipal administrative workers were shot dead in their office in the city hall by members of an unidentified gang. One of the victims of the attack was a member of the PHTK party.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 25 July 2018, in Grand-Goave (Leogane), at Momplaisir, a police officer intervened in a discussion held by two civilians and started shooting, injuring a third civilian who was nearby.

On 25 July 2018, in Mirebalais, Centre, mototaxi drivers and bystanders lynched three men who had killed a mototaxi driver earlier that day. Two men were killed and burnt on the spot, while a third one was taken to the family of his victim to be executed and burnt there. [size=no report]

On 24 July 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a dozen people staged a sit-in protest in front of the Public Prosecutor's Office to denounce the alleged arbitrary arrest of around 50 people in the context of riots that took place across the city a few weeks earlier. [size=a dozen]

On 20 July 2018, two people were killed in l'Arcahaie by armed men who did burst into the building housing of the registry office and opened fire on an influential PHTK activist who worked in this institution. Another employee of the registry office was also killed during this attack. The motive of the crime is unknown but the main target of the bandits was the political activist.
On 14 July 2018, around 100 people marched in Port-au-Prince to demand the resignation of the prime minister.
On 14 July 2018, Haiti Prime Minister Jack Guy Lafontant resigned following deadly violence and looting sparked by a now-abandoned plan to raise fuel prices.
On 14 July 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a female immigration service inspector was shot dead in her car by unidentified masked men on motorbikes (drive-by).

On 10 July 2018, rioters took the streets following the announcement of a significant increase in fuel tariffs, a measure respecting the agreement signed with the International Monetary Fund (IMF). The main roads of the Haitian capital were still blocked by piles of burning tires and sporadic fire still resounded in several districts of the city.

On 9 July 2018, in Gonaives, Artibonite, an unknown number of students staged a violent demonstration against the incumbent government in the context of widespread contention around the increase in fuel prices. The students clashed with the intervening police. [size=no report]

On 9 July 2018, in Petit-Goave, Ouest, an unknown number of people joined a protest organized by the MJKS (Suffering Youth Movement) movement against the costliness of basic goods such as food and fuel, in the context of recent upheaval against the government's decision to increase the fuel prize. [size=no report]

On 9 July 2018, a student from the Faculty of Law and Economics at the State University of Haiti in Port-au-Prince was shot and wounded by police force, as students protested against the rise of petroleum products on July 6. Police broke into the Faculty and arrested 3 students.

On 9 July 2018, a group of armed people marched to the Parliament to demonstrate against the rise of the fuel prices turned into street-fighting when police prevented the rioters to arrive at their destinations. The confrontation with the police also generated lootings of stores and barricades.

On 9 July 2018, in Hinche, Centre, an unknown number of people staged a protest to demand the resignation of President Moise, his government and the members of Parliament after the government announced an increase in fuel prices earlier that week. The main entrance roads to the city were blocked by the protesters. Police forces used tear gas to disperse them. [size=no report]

On 8 July 2018, groups of armed people looted stores and blocked roads ransoming people in Delmas. They demanded the resignation of the prime minister and demonstrated against the increment of the gasoline prices. Police intervened to disperse the rioters by shooting in the air and throwing teargas. Four people have died between July 6 and 8 in Delmas [split in 3 events].

On 8 July 2018, a group of people participated in arson and looting in Port-au-Prince as part of a demonstration against the decision of the government of raising the prices of gasoline. At least seven people were killed during the weekend [split on three events]
On 7 July 2018, people blocked roads with barricades and participated in violent actions in Cap-Haitien to demonstrate against the measure of raising the price of fuel.
On 7 July 2018, people blocked roads with barricades and participated in violent actions in Petit-Goave to demonstrate against the measure of raising the price of fuel.

On 7 July 2018, the sector of Cayes-Jacmel seemed to be under curfew following the announcement of a significant increase in prices of petroleum products at the pump. Rioters put stones and the rain of bottles, through several streets, were the first signal to all citizens of the time to return home, especially those intending to take the road to work.

On 7 July 2018, several demonstrations took place in Belle-Anse following the announcement of a significant increase in prices of petroleum products at the pump. In the main streets, the traffic was completely paralyzed.

On 7 July 2018, the sector of La Valle de Jacmel was under curfew following the announcement of a significant increase in prices of petroleum products at the pump. Rioters put stones and the rain of bottles, through several streets, were the first signal to all citizens of the time to return home, especially those intending to take the road to work.

On 7 July 2018, groups of armed people looted stores and blocked roads ransoming people in Delmas. They demanded the resignation of the prime minister and demonstrated against the increase in the gasoline prices. Police intervened to disperse the rioters by shooting in the air and throwing teargas. Four people have died between July 6 and 8 in Delmas [split in 3 events].

On 7 July 2018, a group of people participated in a fire and in lootings in Port-au-Prince as part of a demonstration against the decision of the government to raise the prices of gasoline. At least seven people were killed during the weekend [split on three events]

On 7 July 2018, in Gonaives, Artibonite, an unknown number of students staged a violent demonstration in Gonaives against the Haitian government and its increase of the fuel prices, erecting barricades of burning tyres on the main roads and vandalizing the department representative delegation's office. [size=no report]

On 7 July 2018, several demonstrations took place in Marigot following the announcement of a significant increase in prices of petroleum products at the pump. In the main streets, the traffic was completely paralyzed. Burning tires, car wrecks, big stones and all kinds of objects have been erected.
On 7 July 2018, people blocked roads with barricades and participated in violent actions in Les Cayes to demonstrate against the measure of raising the price of fuel.
On 7 July 2018, rioters attacked a Best Western Hotel in Petion-Ville as part of a demonstration against the rise in the price of fuel.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
On 6 July 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), an officer from the SWAT team shot and injured a man because he didn't finish serving him gas at a gas station.

On 6 July 2018, groups of armed people looted stores and blocked roads ransoming people in Delmas. They demanded the resignation of the prime minister and demonstrated against the increment of the gasoline prices. Police intervened to disperse the rioters by shooting in the air and throwing teargas. Four people have died between July 6 and 8 in Delmas [split in 3 events].

On 6 July 2018, a group of people participated in a fire and in lootings in Port-au-Prince as part of a demonstration against the decision of the government to raise the prices of gasoline. At least seven people were killed during the weekend [split on three events]. A group of rioters lynched a police agent assuring the security of an opposition leader, as he tried to go through the blockages. They burned his body.
On 6 July 2018, in Gonaives, Artibonite, an unknown number of taxi drivers staged a protest against the increase in oil prices imposed by the government. [size=no report]
On 5 July 2018, one of the leaders of a Martissant-based gang, was killed during clashes in Port-au-Prince. Several gunshots were heard. Several dead reported.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 4 July 2018, in Petion-Ville (Port-au-Prince), police violently conducted a forced eviction at Pelerin 5, forcing persons out of their houses, destroying houses and beating community members from Thomassin, Laboule, Fermathe and Kenscoffe.

On 3 July 2018, in Miragoane, Nippes, an unknown number of people staged a demonstration to demand a solution to a persistent water supply problem. They erected barricades throughout the city and threw stones and bottles at the people trying to climb over them. Police forces used tear gas to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]

Around 30 June 2018 (weekend of), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed clashes took place between the Ti Bwa, Grand Ravine, Village de Dieu and Baz Pilat gangs, in the context of which 5 houses were burnt down and at least one Bi Twa gang member died.

On 28 June 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, around 100 public workers staged a demonstration at the Ministry of Interior to demand the immediate payment of 27 months of outstanding salary. The demonstrators threw rocks at the Ministry and erected burning barricades blocking the road. Police forces intervened to extinguish the fire, but did not clash with the demonstrators. [size=around 100]

Around 22 June 2018 (as reported), around Petion-Ville, Ouest, the son of the Radio-Tele Metropole CEO, was kidnapped and it is assumed that he was killed the same day. His body was found on 29 June 2018 after indications from a suspect.
On 21 June 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a dozen teachers staged a protest to demand their overdue salary. The protest was organized by the CEREH teacher collective. [size=a dozen]

On 19 June 2018, about fifty armed men occupied the Village de Dieu area in Port-au-Prince, defying public agents. They burned down the abandoned houses and terrorized residents, claiming money to tenants or owners of houses.
Labour Group (Haiti); CNOHA: National Coordination for Haitian Workers

On 11 June 2018, hundreds of workers in the textile sector went on strike and reached the streets of Port-au-Prince to demand better working conditions. However, according to the spokesman of the National Center of Haitian Workers (CNOHA), agents of the intervention and law enforcement agency (CIMO) intervened. They prevented the employees from meeting at the Metropolitan Industrial Park and putting their demands forward. According to the spokesman police agents used force even though the protest was peaceful. [size=hundreds]

On 11 June 2018, in Carrefour (Ouest), community members demonstrated with used tires on fire and stone throwing near the Haitian Marine to demand public services, especially concerning drainage and sanitation. [size=no report]

On 1 June 2018, rioters chanted hostile remarks against the mayor of Les Cayes and the ruling power. They clashed with policemen as they attempted to attack the house of the mayor's son and his daughter. The mayor of Les Cayes, Jean Gabriel Fortune, resigned on June 4 after a series of demonstrations.

On 30 May 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), university students occupied the surroundings of the Ethnology college. The protest has been taking place for the past seven weeks to demand job opportunities and employment by the public administration for recent graduates. [size=no report]

On 27 May 2018, unidentified individuals opened fired on the car of the departmental coordinator of the great rally for the evolution of Haiti in Cap-Haitien. The attack came after the condemnation of the killing of one member of the orchestra, Tropicana Haiti.
On 24 May 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), unidentified gangs clashed with each other in the Martissant neighborhood and a barricade was set up. No reports of injuries nor deaths.
On 24 May 2018, in Petit-Goave (Ouest), high school students from the Vialet National School protested against the precarious conditions of the school. [size=no report]

On 22 May 2018, workers from the textile sector took the streets of the capital for a second consecutive day of mobilization. The protesters marched on the road to the airport in Port-au-Prince. The protesters were demanding an adjustment of the minimum wage, the reinstatement of workers arbitrarily dismissed, and denouncing bosses' intimidation campaigns against factory employees.

On 21 May 2018, workers from the textile sector started a protest on the streets of the capital. The protesters marched on the road to the airport in Port-au-Prince. Workers were demanding an adjustment of the minimum wage, the reinstatement of workers arbitrarily dismissed, and denouncing bosses' intimidation campaigns against factory employees.

On 14 May 2018, the Union of Employees of the Vehicle Insurance Agency is in its seventh week of strike. Employees are gathered in various corners of the institution in Tabarre in Port-au-Prince to demand the unconditional release of Cadet Jean Philistin and Junior Jean Baptiste - employees of the agency, the departure of the restructuring commission of the institution, and a dialogue between strikers and representatives of the state authorities.
On 10 May 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), an unidentified gang clashed with the Police in the Martissant neighborhood. No reports of injuries nor deaths.
On 1 May 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), Grand-Ravine Gang clashed with Ti Bwa Gang in the Martissant neighborhood, resulting in one person killed.
Alterpresse; Loop News Haiti; Le Nouvelliste

On 28 April 2018, in Cap-Haitian (Nord), unidentified men launched a toxic gas, some reports say tear gas, at a restaurant during a conference delivered by Senators on the Petro Caribe corruption scandal. One journalist died of suffocation and another person was injured as the crowd panicked to exit the place.

On 27 April 2018, in Thiotte (Sud-Est), unidentified men set fire to vehicles while they were transporting police officers from the Brigade of Intervention Against Land Insecurity. No injuries reported and perpetrators unknown.

On 26 April 2018, in Les Cayes (Sud), for the second consecutive day, businesspeople from the central market protested against the mayor and the decision to demolish the central market building and build a new one. [size=no report]

On 25 April 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), students from the La Saline school demonstrated demanding classes, as teachers are not working as they have not received their payments for months in a row. They threw stones at the Police and destroyed windshields of cars, the Police intervened and used teargas. [size=no report]
On 25 April 2018, in Les Cayes (Sud), businesspeople from the central market protested against the authority's decision to demolish the central market building and build a new one. [size=no report]
On 25 April 2018, in Petion-Ville (Ouest), community members from Pernier protested demanding repairs to the road, which is constantly affected by flooding. [size=no report]

On 23 April 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), students from the La Saline school protested demanding classes, as teachers are not working as they have not received their payments for several consecutive months. Police intervened and used teargas to disperse the protesters. [size=no report]
PPD: Platfom Pitit Desalin; BOD: Democratic Opposition Block

On 18 April 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), a group of opposition supporters led by the Platfom Pitit Desalina (PPD) demonstrated against the government near the Petion-Ville neighborhood. One of the demonstrators was shot and killed. The opposition accused the police of the killing while the government claimed that a civilian was responsible. The victim was part of the Democratic Opposition Block (BOD) movement. [size=no report]

Around 17 April 2018 (as reported), in Leogane (Ouest), unidentified armed gang members attacked the court house, spreading faecal matter on it and forcing it to close down. Motive unknown and no deaths nor injuries reported.
On 16 April 2018, the commissioner of the government of Petit-Goave was physically aggressed in the commune of Leogane by two criminals after he was threatened.

On 16 April 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), community members from the Raboto neighborhood demonstrated to demand the release of a radio presenter recently detained on multiple charges. They set up street barricades, were armed with bottles and stones and clashed with police officers who used teargas and gunfire to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]

On 12 April 2018, dozens of individuals blocked the streets of Magny, Magloire Ambroise opposite the Faculty of Ethnology and Saint-Honore claiming they belong to the State University of Haiti (UEH) in Port-au-Prince. They demand their integration into the public administration. This demonstration caused huge traffic jams in the city center.

On 12 April 2018, residents of the Greater Port-au-Prince city called for the arrest of several suspected gang leaders. Protesters in the streets ask the police chief and justice minister to apprehend two gang leaders, accusing them of creating a climate of terror in the sector.

On 11 April 2018, a demonstration took place against the gang leader Arnel at Village of God in Port-au-Prince. People took to the streets to demand the arrest of a man believed to be the source of much of the insecurity in the slum. The protesters say they will not cede their homes to the bandits.
RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network

On 9 April 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), overnight, unidentified armed men attacked the outside of the headquarters of the RNDDH, the National Human Rights Defense Network, shooting at it. An envelope with a threatening message and bullets were left at the scene.
On 9 April 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), students from the Geology School blocked a road with chairs and rocks to demand the re-opening of the school, closed ten months ago. [size=no report]
On 8 April 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), a civil employee of the police (off-duty) was shot and killed by supposed members of an unidentified gang from Cite de Dieu.
On 8 April 2018, in Saint-Louis du Nord (Nord-Ouest), two men on a motorcycle conducted a drive-by shooting, killing the sister of the Minister of Education. Perpetrators unknown.
On 28 March 2018, more than 200 journalists marched in Port-au-Prince to demand information about the disappearance of the journalist Vladjimir Legagneur.
On 27 March 2018, in Les Cayes (Sud), businesspeople from the central market protested against the authority's decision to demolish the central market building. [size=no report]

On 27 March 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), students from the University of the State of Haiti denounced and protested against the policy of favouritism of the government, as well as lack of job opportunities in the country. [size=no report]
On 20 March 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), students marched to demand internships to complete their higher education. [size=no report]

On 16 March 2018, opposition leader - Children of Dessalines - Moise Jean Charles led a street demonstration in Cap-Haitien, the country's second largest city. Protesting with posters, demonstrators denounced the regime and corruption, which they believe affects the national economy.
Around 14 March 2018 (as reported), in Thomassique (Centre), the mayor of the city and another person were shot and injured by an unidentified armed man near Boc Banique. No deaths reported.
On 14 March 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), students marched to demand internships to complete their superior education and blocked a road with large rocks and set tires on fire. [size=no report]
On 14 March 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a photojournalist was shot and killed by members of an armed group in the Grand Ravine neighbourhood. 1 fatality.
On 14 March 2018, a journalist disappeared after going to report in the neighborhood Martissant in Port-au-Prince, Haiti. That neighborhood has been affected by clash between gangs.

On 10 March 2018, five people, four of them police, were injured in Miragoane during the funeral of young Robenson Francois, who was killed in an armed attack on Feb 16. Clashes erupted as police intervened

On 8 March 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), tens of women from many organizations, such as Kay fanm, SOFA, solidarity of Haitian women, Toya Foundation, AFASDA, the Sun of Haiti Association of Women and Konbit Fanm Saj, conducted a sit-in on the International Day of Women to protest, denouncing anti-feminist stances of the government, corruption, misery, injustice, lack of education and others. [size=tens]

Around 28 February 2018 (week of), in Jean-Rabel (Nord-Ouest), high school students demonstrated in solidarity with the teachers' strike. Police intervened with teargas as they claimed that the students threw stones. [size=no report]

Around 28 February 2018 (week of), in Port-de-Paix (Nord-Ouest), high school students demonstrated in solidarity with the teachers' strike. Police intervened with teargas as they claimed that the students threw stones. [size=no report]

On 28 February 2018, five students in Petit-Goave were arrested by the police. Several were beaten by the police and injured while they were protesting. Protesters demanded that the Ministry of National Education and Training pay wage arrears, improve working conditions, and regularize the status of all the teachers of the school.

On 28 February 2018, there was a clash between students and police. An unexpected demonstration of teachers and students took place in the streets of Cite Soleil in Port-au-Prince, as students walked to support teachers on strike. Police intervened to disperse the crowd, throwing teargas. Several students injured. [size=no report]

On 27 February 2018, in Limbe, students of Jean Baptiste Cineas high school blocked the circulation of vehicles for long hours before being dislodged by the national police. The young protesters are protesting the lack of funding for education.

On 27 February 2018, in Cap-Haitien, for a second day in a row, students from high schools in the city violently demonstrated through the streets, demanding the functioning of high schools. Students have denounced the treatment inflicted on them since the beginning of the current school year. According to them, teachers are almost absent in the classrooms.

On 26 February 2018, in Cap-Haitien, students from high schools in the city violently demonstrated through the streets, demanding the functioning of high schools. According to the students, teachers are almost absent in the classrooms.
On 26 February 2018, in Gonaives (Artibonites), students and workers protested demanding job opportunities in government offices and called out the migration of qualified Haitians. [size=no report]

On 22 February 2018, in Miragoane (Nippes), a group of senators marched from the Saint-Therese church to protest against a recent attack against civilians which they claim was politically-motivated and targeting political opposers. [size=no report]

On 19 February 2018,merchants who were victims of the fires in the market ''Hyppolite'' on February 13 and the market ''Gerit'' on February 18 marched peacefully. The march took place in the streets of the capital of Port-au-Prince.

On 15 February 2018, in Miragoane (Nippes), armed men shot and killed a man and injured another, as well as a woman. The woman was the daughter of a political activist who had recently been investigating acts of corruption linked to Petrocaribe's frauds, so the motive might be political. Other unfunded allegations include that supposed members of the PHTK, the Haitian Tet Kale Party, are involved in such attacks and do so in collusion with and under the protection of the Police.
On 6 February 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), teachers marched from Champs-de-mars to demand increased salaries across the education sector. [size=no report]

On 6 February 2018, residents of several communal sections of the municipality of Torbeck, with signs and tree branches denounced the slowness of the caravan government called ''Caravan of change.'' and protested the lack of electricity since Hurricane Matthew.

On 1 February 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), tens of protesters, including members from the UNNOH, the National Union of Haitian Teachers, conducted a sit-in in front of the municipal building to protest against the participation of the band Sweet Micky of former President Michel Joseph Martelly, at the national carnival. Rocks were thrown at the protesters and police had to intervene to re-establish peace. [size=tens]

Around 30 January 2018 (as reported), in Gonaives (Artibonites), students from the Gonaives Public University protested against the dismissal of a professor and claimed that the poor management of the institution resulted in abuse of power and arbitrary dismissals. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2018, in Gonaives (Artibonites), around twenty persons, some of them former professors, armed with sticks, machetes, ice picks and knives tried to kill the public university dean while he was participating in a radio show. Police intervened and dispersed the group. The dean was previously accused of poor management. No reports of injuries. [size=around 20]

On 28 January 2018, there was a clash between the Haitian National Police and some people who demanded a compensation for destruction of the College King Christophe de Gressier. The premises of the school were destroyed, looted, and vandalized. School children and their parents and other members of the population decided to occupy a highway. To disperse the crowd demonstrating the eviction, the police have launched canisters of tear gas. Heavy automatic gunfire and stone-throwing between rioters and police officers followed. Windshields of several vehicles were broken, several students fell into syncope under the effect of tear gas.

On 26 January 2018, in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), students, who were expelled for vandalism, tried to re-enter the University of the State of Haiti. Police intervened with teargas and students threw rocks at them. No reports of injuries. [size=no report]
On 22 January 2018, a group of people led by different political parties from the opposition protested against the government and demanded the resignation of the president.

On 18 January 2018, street demonstration took place in Miragoane to continue to demand the resignation of the departmental delegate of Nippes, Guyvard Labbe. Armed with tree branches and accompanied by a walking band and a truck equipped with a sound system, citizens expressed their dissatisfaction and force the departmental delegate Guyvard Labbe to resign, arguing that he is not qualified for the position.

On 18 January 2018, human rights activists and lawyers protested in front of the US embassy in Port-au-Prince against the decision of Donald Trump to remove the legal status to Haitian immigrant in the US.

On 9 January 2018, dozens of participants responded to opposition leader Jean Charles Moise's call to take part in an anti-government demonstration. The event began in Petion-Ville with the objective of reaching the city center of Port-au-Prince, via the Delmas road. As a unknown man launched a teargas to the crowd, rioters attempted to lynch a supposed partner of the former. After this incident, the rioters attacked everything on their way. Several windshields of vehicles were broken. Some demonstrators threw stones at shops and supermarkets in the area.

Around 8 January 2018 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince (Ouest), teachers from 38 primary schools around the country marched to protest against the institutional status and renumeration of teachers. [size=at least 38]
